analyzed: vajjasutta
translated: Faults

analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:

analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti
translated: “Bhikkhus!”

analyzed: bhadanta iti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ
translated: “Venerable sir!” those bhikkhus replied.

analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

analyzed: dve imāni bhikkhave vajjāni

analyzed: katamāni dve
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikam ca vajjam samparāyikam ca vajja
translated: The fault that is visible here and now and the fault that appears in the next world.

original: Katamañca, bhikkhave, diṭṭhadhammikaṁ vajjaṁ?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco passati coraṁ āgucāriṁ rājāno gahetvā vividhā kammakāraṇā kārente;🔽kasāhipi tāḷente, vettehipi tāḷente, addhadaṇḍakehipi tāḷente, hatthampi chindante,
analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave diṭṭhadhammikam vajja  idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ passati coram āgu cārim rājānaḥ gahetvā vividhā kamma kāraṇā kārente  kasāhi pi tāḷente vettehi pi tāḷente addhadaṇḍakehi pi tāḷente hattham pi chindante
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the fault that is visible here and now?

original: pādampi chindante, hatthapādampi chindante, kaṇṇampi chindante, nāsampi chindante,
analyzed: pādam pi chindante hattha pādam pi chindante kaṇṇam pi chindante nāsam pi chindante
translated: Here, bhikkhus, someone sees a thief, an evil-doer, caught in the act, brought before the king, and the king having him beaten with whips, beaten with canes, beaten with clubs, having his hands cut off, his feet cut off, his hands and feet cut off, his ears cut off, his nose cut off, his ears and nose cut off; having him wrapped in a skin and dragged by a team of oxen hither and thither along a rugged road; having him enclosed in an oil-jar and set on fire; having him thrown to dogs to be devoured; having him impaled on a stake; having him beheaded.

original: kaṇṇanāsampi chindante, bilaṅgathālikampi karonte, saṅkhamuṇḍikampi karonte, rāhumukhampi🔽karonte, jotimālikampi karonte, hatthapajjotikampi karonte, erakavattikampi karonte,
analyzed: kaṇṇa nāsam chindante bilaṅga thālikam pi karonte saṅkha muṇḍikam pi karonte rāhu mukham pi  karonte joti mālikam pi karonte hattha pajjotikam pi karonte eraka vattikam pi karonte
translated: when they cut off their ears and noses, when they make them carry a wooden plank, when they make them wear a garland of grass,🔽when they make them wear a garland of dog’s feces, when they make them wear a garland of burning sticks, when they make them wear a garland of burning rags, when they make them wear a garland of burning straw,

translated: when they make them wear a garland of burning cow dung, when they make them wear a garland of burning chaff, when they make them wear a garland of burning sticks,🔽when they make them lie on a bed of live coals, when they make them lie on a bed of live embers, when they make them lie on a bed of live ashes,🔽when they make them lie on a bed of live cow dung, when they make them lie on a bed of live chaff, when they make them lie on a bed of live sticks,

analyzed: kasāhi pi tāḷenti vettehi pi tāḷenti addhadaṇḍakehi pi tāḷenti hattham pi chindanti
translated: when they make them lie on a bed of live rags, when they make them lie on a bed of live grass, when they make them lie on a bed of live wood, when they make them lie on a bed of live cow dung, when they make them lie on a bed of live chaff, when they make them lie on a bed of live sticks,🔽when they make them lie on a bed of live rags, when they make them lie on a bed of live grass, when they make them lie on

original: pādampi chindanti, hatthapādampi chindanti, kaṇṇampi chindanti, nāsampi chindanti,
analyzed: pādam pi chindanti hattha pādam pi chindanti kaṇṇam pi chindanti nāsam pi chindanti
translated: They cut off their feet, their hands and feet, their ears, their noses,

original: kaṇṇanāsampi chindanti, bilaṅgathālikampi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikampi karonti, rāhumukhampi🔽karonti, jotimālikampi karonti, hatthapajjotikampi karonti, erakavattikampi karonti,🔽cīrakavāsikampi karonti, eṇeyyakampi karonti, baḷisamaṁsikampi karonti, kahāpaṇikampi
analyzed: kaṇṇa nāsam chindanti bilaṅga thālikam pi karonti saṅkha muṇḍikam pi karonti rāhumukham pi  karonti joti mālikam pi karonti hattha pajjotikam pi karonti eraka vattikam pi karonti  cīrakavāsikam pi karonti eṇeyyakam pi karonti baḷisamasikam pi karonti kahāpaṇikam pi
translated: their hands and noses, they cut off their ears and noses, they make them a ‘pound of flesh’, they make them a ‘shell-head’, they make them a ‘Rahu’s mouth’,🔽they make them a ‘torch-ring’, they make them a ‘hand-torch’, they make them a ‘deer-foot’, they make them a ‘fish-tail’, they make them a ‘coin-mark’,

original: karonti, khārāpatacchikampi karonti, palighaparivattikampi karonti, palālapīṭhakampi
analyzed: karonti khārāpatacchikam pi karonti paligha parivattikam pi karonti palāla pīṭhakam pi
translated: they make them a ‘salt-measure’, they make them a ‘yo-yo’, they make them a ‘straw-bundle’,

original: karonti, tattenapi telena osiñcanti, sunakhehipi khādāpenti, jīvantampi sūle uttāsenti,
analyzed: karonti tat tena api telena osiñcanti sunakhehi khādāpenti jīvantam pi sūle uttāsenti
translated: they pour in molten red-hot copper, they make them be eaten by dogs, they make them be impaled alive,

analyzed: asinā api sīsam chindanti
translated: they cut off their heads with a sword.

original: Ahañceva kho pana evarūpaṁ pāpakammaṁ kareyyaṁ, mampi rājāno gahetvā evarūpā vividhā kammakāraṇā kāreyyuṁ;
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana evarūpam pāpa kammam kareyya mam pi rājānaḥ gahetvā evarūpā vividhā kamma kāraṇā kāreyyu
translated: If I were to do such a bad deed, the kings would arrest me and make me suffer in various ways.

analyzed: tāḷeyyum asinā api sīsam chindeyyunti
translated: They’d beat me with sticks … with swords …

original: So diṭṭhadhammikassa vajjassa bhīto na paresaṁ pābhataṁ vilumpanto carati.
analyzed: so diṭṭhadhammikassa vajjassa bhītaḥ na paresam pābhatam vilumpantaḥ carati
translated: Fearing the danger of the present life, he doesn’t steal the belongings of others.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave diṭṭhadhammikam vajja
translated: This is called the danger of the present life.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave samparāyikam vajja
translated: And what is the danger of the next life?

analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: It’s when someone reflects:

original: ‘kāyaduccaritassa kho pana pāpako dukkho vipāko abhisamparāyaṁ, vacīduccaritassa pāpako dukkho vipāko abhisamparāyaṁ, manoduccaritassa pāpako dukkho vipāko abhisamparāyaṁ.
analyzed: kāya duccaritassa kho pana pāpakaḥ dukkhaḥ vipākaḥ abhisamparāya vacī duccaritassa pāpakaḥ dukkhaḥ vipākaḥ abhisamparāya manaḥ duccaritassa pāpakaḥ dukkhaḥ vipākaḥ abhisamparāya
translated: ‘Bad bodily action has a bad result for a long time in the next life. Bad verbal action has a bad result for a long time in the next life. Bad mental action has a bad result for a long time in the next life.

original: Ahañceva kho pana kāyena duccaritaṁ careyyaṁ, vācāya duccaritaṁ careyyaṁ, manasā duccaritaṁ careyyaṁ.
analyzed: aham ca iva kho pana kāyena duccaritam careyya vācāya duccaritam careyya manasā duccaritam careyya
translated: If I were to do bad bodily, verbal, or mental actions,

original: Kiñca taṁ yāhaṁ na kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjeyyan’ti.
analyzed: kiñca tam yā aham na kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjeyyanti
translated: what would happen to me when my body breaks up and after death?’

original: So samparāyikassa vajjassa bhīto kāyaduccaritaṁ pahāya kāyasucaritaṁ bhāveti, vacīduccaritaṁ
analyzed: saḥ samparāyikassa vajjassa bhītaḥ kāya duccaritam pahāya kāya su caritam bhāveti vacī duccarita
translated: Fearing the danger of the next world, he abandons bodily misconduct and develops bodily good conduct; he abandons verbal misconduct and develops verbal good conduct; he abandons mental misconduct and develops mental good conduct.

original: pahāya vacīsucaritaṁ bhāveti, manoduccaritaṁ pahāya manosucaritaṁ bhāveti, suddhaṁ attānaṁ pariharati.
analyzed: pahāya vacī su caritam bhāveti manaḥ duccaritam pahāya manaḥ su caritam bhāveti suddham attānam pariharati
translated: Frightened by the danger that is to be experienced in the next world, he abandons bodily misconduct and develops bodily good conduct; he abandons verbal misconduct and develops verbal good conduct; he abandons mental misconduct and develops mental good conduct; he lives with a purified livelihood.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave samparāyikam vajja
translated: This is called the danger that is to be experienced in the next world.

analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave dve vajjāni
translated: These are the two dangers.

analyzed: tasmāt iha bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, bhikkhus, you should train yourselves thus:

original: ‘diṭṭhadhammikassa vajjassa bhāyissāma, samparāyikassa vajjassa bhāyissāma, vajjabhīruno bhavissāma vajjabhayadassāvino’ti.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammikassa vajjassa bhāyissāma samparāyikassa vajjassa bhāyissāma vajja bhīrunaḥ bhavissāma vajja bhaya dassāvino ti
translated: ‘We will be afraid of the danger that is to be experienced in this very life and of the danger that is to be experienced in the next world; we will be afraid of dangers, and we will see fear in dangers.’

analyzed: evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabba
translated: It is in this way, bhikkhus, that you should train yourselves.

original: Vajjabhīruno, bhikkhave, vajjabhayadassāvino etaṁ pāṭikaṅkhaṁ yaṁ parimuccissati sabbavajjehī”ti.🔽Paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: vajja bhīrunaḥ bhikkhave vajja bhaya dassāvinaḥ etam pāṭikaṅkham yam parimuccissati sabba vajjehi iti  paṭhama
translated: For one who is afraid of dangers and sees fear in dangers, it is proper to expect that he will be liberated from all dangers.”🔽The first section for recitation on the dangers is finished.

analyzed: padhāna sutta
translated: 1. The section on striving

analyzed: dve imāni bhikkhave padhānāni durabhisambhavāni lokasmi
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these two strivings that are difficult to do in the world.

analyzed: katamāni dve
translated: What two?

analyzed: yat ca gihīnam agāram ajjhāvasatam cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāra an uppadānattha
translated: And the striving of householders who live at home for the sake of robes, alms-food, a resting place, and medicinal requisites,

original: padhānaṁ, yañca agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitānaṁ sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggatthaṁ padhānaṁ.
analyzed: yat ca agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajitānam sabba upadhi paṭinissagga attham padhāna
translated: and the striving of those gone forth for the relinquishment of all attachments.

original: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, dve padhānāni durabhisambhavāni lokasmiṁ.🔽Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imesaṁ dvinnaṁ padhānānaṁ yadidaṁ sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggatthaṁ padhānaṁ.
analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave dve padhānāni durabhisambhavāni lokasmi  etad agga bhikkhave imesam dvinnam padhānānam yat idam sabba upadhi paṭinissagga attham padhāna
translated: These are the two strivings in the world that are hard to carry out.🔽The best of these two strivings is the striving for the relinquishment of all attachments.

analyzed: tasmāt iha bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, bhikkhus, you should train yourselves thus:

analyzed: sabba upadhi paṭinissagga attham padhānam padahissāma ati  evam hi vaḥ bhikkhave sikkhitabbanti
translated: ‘We will strive for the relinquishment of all attachments.’

analyzed: dutiya
translated: It is in such a way that you should train yourselves.”🔽The second section on strivings is finished.

analyzed: tapanīya sutta
translated: The Burning

analyzed: dve me bhikkhave dhammā tapanīyā
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these two things that burn.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa kāyaduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti kāyasucaritaṁ;
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccassa kāya duccaritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: Here, someone has committed evil bodily actions, spoken evil words, and had evil thoughts.

original: vacīduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti vacīsucaritaṁ;
analyzed: vacī duccaritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: He has failed to do good bodily actions, good verbal actions, and good mental actions.

original: manoduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti manosucaritaṁ.🔽So ‘kāyaduccaritaṁ me katan’ti tappati, ‘akataṁ me kāyasucaritan’ti tappati;
analyzed: katam hoti a katam hoti  saḥ kāya duccaritam me tappati a katam me tappati
translated: He has done what is misconduct by mind and not done what is good conduct by mind.🔽He feels remorse, thinking, ‘I have done what is misconduct by body. I haven’t done what is good conduct by body.’

original: ‘vacīduccaritaṁ me katan’ti tappati, ‘akataṁ me vacīsucaritan’ti tappati;
analyzed: vacī duccaritam me tappati a katam me tappati
translated: He feels remorse, thinking, ‘I have done what is misconduct by speech. I haven’t done what is good conduct by speech.’

original: ‘manoduccaritaṁ me katan’ti tappati, ‘akataṁ me manosucaritan’ti tappati.
analyzed: manaḥ duccaritam me tappati a katam me tappati
translated: He feels remorse, thinking, ‘I have done what is misconduct by mind. I haven’t done what is good conduct by mind.’

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā tapanīyā”ti.🔽Tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve dhammā tapanīyā ati  tatiya
translated: These are the two things that cause remorse.”

analyzed: atapanīya sutta
translated: The third section on remorse🔽The one that does not cause remorse

analyzed: dve me bhikkhave dhammā a tapanīyā
translated: “Monks, there are these two things that do not cause remorse.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa kāyasucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti kāyaduccaritaṁ;
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccassa kāya sucaritam katam hoti a katam hoti kāya duccarita
translated: There is the case where someone has done what is good conduct by body, not what is misconduct by body;

original: vacīsucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti vacīduccaritaṁ;
analyzed: vacīsu caritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: has done what is good conduct by speech, not what is misconduct by speech;

original: manosucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti manoduccaritaṁ.
analyzed: manaḥ su caritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: has done what is good conduct by mind, not what is misconduct by mind.

original: So ‘kāyasucaritaṁ me katan’ti na tappati, ‘akataṁ me kāyaduccaritan’ti na tappati;
analyzed: so kāya su caritam me katanti na tappati a katam me na tappati
translated: He doesn’t feel remorse, thinking, ‘I have done what is good conduct by body. I haven’t done what is misconduct by body.’

original: ‘vacīsucaritaṁ me katan’ti na tappati, ‘akataṁ me vacīduccaritan’ti na tappati;
analyzed: me na tappati a katam me na tappati
translated: He doesn’t regret that he’s done what’s good by way of speech, nor that he hasn’t done what’s bad by way of speech.

original: ‘manosucaritaṁ me katan’ti na tappati, ‘akataṁ me manoduccaritan’ti na tappati.
analyzed: manaḥ su caritam me na tappati a katam me na tappati
translated: He doesn’t regret that he’s done what’s good by way of thought, nor that he hasn’t done what’s bad by way of thought.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā atapanīyā”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve dhammā a tapanīyā ati
translated: These are the two things that don’t cause regret.”🔽The fourth section on the two things is finished.

analyzed: catuttha  upaññāta sutta
translated: The Realized One

analyzed: dvinna aha bhikkhave dhammānam
translated: “Monks, I’ve realized two things:

original: yā ca asantuṭṭhitā kusalesu dhammesu, yā ca appaṭivānitā padhānasmiṁ.
analyzed: yā ca a santuṭṭhitā kusalesu dhammesu yā ca a paṭivānitā padhāna smi
translated: being dissatisfied with skillful qualities and not giving up striving.

analyzed: appaṭivānī sudāha bhikkhave padahāmi
translated: I don’t give up striving, thinking,

original: ‘kāmaṁ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṁsalohitaṁ, yaṁ🔽taṁ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṁ na taṁ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
analyzed: kāmam taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu sarīre upassussatu ya  tam purisa thāmena purisa vīriyena purisa parakkamena pattabbam na tam apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
translated: ‘Even if my skin, sinews, and bones wither up, and my blood and flesh dry up and shrivel, I will not give up striving

analyzed: saṇṭhānam bhavissati iti
translated: until I have attained what can be attained through human effort, human strength, and human endurance.’🔽Through diligence, I attained supreme full awakening.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, appamādādhigatā sambodhi, appamādādhigato anuttaro yogakkhemo.
analyzed: tassa bhikkhave appamāda adhigatā sambodhi appamāda adhigataḥ anuttaraḥ yogakkhemo
translated: Through diligence, I attained supreme freedom.

analyzed: tumhe ce ipi bhikkhave appaṭivānam padaheyyātha
translated: If you were to make an effort without giving up,

original: ‘kāmaṁ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṁsalohitaṁ, yaṁ🔽taṁ purisathāmena purisavīriyena purisaparakkamena pattabbaṁ na taṁ apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
analyzed: kāmam taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu sarīre upassussatu ya  tam purisa thāmena purisa vīriyena purisa parakkamena pattabbam na tam apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa
translated: thinking, ‘Even if my skin, sinews, and bones wither up,

analyzed: saṇṭhānam bhavissati iti tumhe pi bhikkhave nacirassa eva
translated: still I will not give up my effort without having attained what can be attained by manly strength, manly persistence, and manly energy,’

original: yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissatha.
analyzed: yassa atthāya kula puttā sammad eva agārasma anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosānam diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissatha
translated: then you too would soon realize with your own insight that unsurpassed consummation of the spiritual life for the sake of which clansmen rightly go forth from the household life into homelessness, and you would dwell in it.

analyzed: tasmāt iha bhikkhave evam sikkhitabba
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train yourselves thus:

original: ‘appaṭivānaṁ padahissāma.🔽Kāmaṁ taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upassussatu maṁsalohitaṁ, yaṁ
analyzed: appaṭivānam padahissāma  kāmam taco ca nhāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu sarīre upassussatu ya
translated: ‘We will make an effort without giving up.🔽Even if our skin, sinews, and bones wither up,

analyzed: tam purisa thāmena purisa vīriyena purisa parakkamena pattabbam na tam apāpuṇitvā vīriyassa

translated: Contemplating the enjoyment in things that give rise to fetters, and contemplating the dispassion in things that give rise to fetters.

original: Saṁyojaniyesu, bhikkhave, dhammesu assādānupassī viharanto rāgaṁ na pajahati, dosaṁ na pajahati, mohaṁ na pajahati.
analyzed: sayojaniyesu bhikkhave dhammesu assāda anupassī viharantaḥ rāgam na pajahati dosam na pajahati moham na pajahati
translated: When you live contemplating the enjoyment in things that give rise to fetters, you don’t abandon passion, aversion, or delusion.

original: Rāgaṁ appahāya, dosaṁ appahāya, mohaṁ appahāya na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi.
analyzed: rāgam appahāya dosam appahāya moham appahāya na parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi
translated: Not abandoning passion, aversion, and delusion, you’re not freed from rebirth, old age, and death, from sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

analyzed: na parimuccati dukkhasma ati vadāmi
translated: You’re not freed, I say, from suffering and stress.

original: Saṁyojaniyesu, bhikkhave, dhammesu nibbidānupassī viharanto rāgaṁ pajahati, dosaṁ pajahati, mohaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: sayojaniyesu bhikkhave dhammesu nibbida anupassī viharantaḥ rāgam pajahati dosam pajahati moham pajahati
translated: When you live contemplating the dispassion in things that give rise to fetters, you abandon passion, aversion, and delusion.

original: Rāgaṁ pahāya, dosaṁ pahāya, mohaṁ pahāya, parimuccati jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi.

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, ime dve sukkā dhammā lokaṁ pālenti tasmā paññāyati mātāti vā mātucchāti vā mātulānīti vā ācariyabhariyāti vā garūnaṁ dārāti vā”ti.🔽Navamaṁ.

translated: “And what is the power of reflection?

analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: There is the case where a person reflects thus:

original: ‘kāyaduccaritassa kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, vacīduccaritassa🔽pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, manoduccaritassa pāpako vipāko
analyzed: kāya duccaritassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca vacī duccaritassa  pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca manaḥ duccaritassa pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: ‘Evil actions have been declared by the Blessed One to be of immediate consequence in the here & now, and to have immediate results in the here & now.🔽Evil actions have been declared by the Blessed One to be of immediate consequence in the here & now, and to have immediate results in the here & now.

original: diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāyaduccaritaṁ pahāya kāyasucaritaṁ bhāveti, vacīduccaritaṁ pahāya
analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  so iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāya duccaritam pahāya kāya su caritam bhāva iti vacī duccaritam pahāya
translated: Evil actions have been declared by the Blessed One to be of immediate consequence in the here & now, and to have immediate results in the here & now.’

original: vacīsucaritaṁ bhāveti, manoduccaritaṁ pahāya manosucaritaṁ bhāveti, suddhaṁ attānaṁ pariharati.
analyzed: vacī su caritam bhāva iti manaḥ duccaritam pahāya manaḥ su caritam bhāva iti suddham attānam pariharati
translated: Having reflected in this way, he abandons evil, unskillful qualities that have already arisen and doesn’t generate those that haven’t yet arisen. He generates skillful qualities that haven’t yet arisen and abandons those that have arisen. He purifies his mind with a mind of good will.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave paṭisaṅkhāna bala
translated: This is called the power of reflection.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: “And what is the power of development?

original: Tatra, bhikkhave, yamidaṁ bhāvanābalaṁ sekhānametaṁ balaṁ.
analyzed: tatra bhikkhave yam idam bhāvanā balam sekhānam etam bala
translated: The strength of development is for a trainee.

original: Sekhañhi so, bhikkhave, balaṁ āgamma rāgaṁ pajahati, dosaṁ pajahati, mohaṁ pajahati.
analyzed: sekhan hi saḥ bhikkhave balam āgamma rāgam pajahati dosam pajahati moham pajahati
translated: For it is by depending on the strength of a trainee that one abandons lust, hatred, and delusion.

original: Rāgaṁ pahāya, dosaṁ pahāya, mohaṁ pahāya yaṁ akusalaṁ na taṁ karoti, yaṁ pāpaṁ na taṁ sevati.
analyzed: rāgam pahāya dosam pahāya moham pahāya yam akusalam na tam karoti yam pāpam na tam sevati
translated: Having abandoned lust, hatred, and delusion, one does not do what is unwholesome, one does not pursue what is evil.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: This is called the strength of development.

analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave dve balāni iti
translated: These are the two strengths.”

analyzed: dve imāni bhikkhave balāni
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these two strengths.

analyzed: katamāni dve
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna balañca bhāvanā balañca
translated: The strength of reflection and the strength of development.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave paṭisaṅkhāna bala
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the strength of reflection?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco iti paṭisañcikkhati:🔽‘kāyaduccaritassa kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, vacīduccaritassa🔽pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, manoduccaritassa pāpako vipāko
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati  kāya duccaritassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca vacī duccaritassa  pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca manaḥ duccaritassa pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ
translated: Here someone reflects thus:🔽‘Misconduct by body has an unhappy result both in this very life and in the next;🔽misconduct by speech has an unhappy result both in this very life and in the next;

analyzed: diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati
translated: misconduct by mind has an unhappy result both in this very life and in the next.’

original: So iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāyaduccaritaṁ pahāya kāyasucaritaṁ bhāveti, vacīduccaritaṁ pahāya
analyzed: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāya duccaritam pahāya kāya su caritam bhāva iti vacī duccaritam pahāya
translated: Having reflected thus, he abandons bodily misconduct and develops bodily good conduct, abandons verbal misconduct and develops verbal good conduct,

original: vacīsucaritaṁ bhāveti, manoduccaritaṁ pahāya manosucaritaṁ bhāveti, suddhaṁ attānaṁ pariharati.
analyzed: vacī su caritam bhāva iti manaḥ duccaritam pahāya manaḥ su caritam bhāva iti suddham attānam pariharati
translated: Having reflected thus, he abandons evil bodily conduct and develops good bodily conduct; he abandons evil verbal conduct and develops good verbal conduct; he abandons evil mental conduct and develops good mental conduct; he keeps himself pure in bodily conduct,🔽in verbal conduct, and in mental conduct.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave paṭisaṅkhāna bala
translated: This is called the strength of reflection.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the strength of development?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vosaggapariṇāmiṁ,🔽dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti …
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu sati sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vosagga pariṇāmi  dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: Here, bhikkhus, a bhikkhu develops the enlightenment factor of mindfulness, which is based upon seclusion, dispassion, and cessation, maturing in release;🔽he develops the enlightenment factor of discrimination of phenomena …

analyzed: vīriya sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  pīti sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti
translated: the enlightenment factor of energy …🔽the enlightenment factor of rapture …

analyzed: passaddhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti  samādhi sambojjhaṅgam bhāva iti
translated: the enlightenment factor of tranquillity …🔽the enlightenment factor of concentration …

original: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāveti vivekanissitaṁ virāganissitaṁ nirodhanissitaṁ vosaggapariṇāmiṁ.
analyzed: upekkhā sambojjhaṅgam bhāveti viveka nissitam virāga nissitam nirodha nissitam vosagga pariṇāmi
translated: the enlightenment factor of equanimity, which is based upon seclusion, dispassion, and cessation, maturing in release.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: This is called the strength of development.

analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave dve balāni iti
translated: These are the two powers.”

analyzed: dve imāni bhikkhave balāni
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these two powers.

analyzed: katamāni dve
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: paṭisaṅkhāna balañca bhāvanā balañca
translated: The power of reflection and the power of development.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave paṭisaṅkhāna bala
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the power of reflection?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco iti paṭisañcikkhati:🔽‘kāyaduccaritassa kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, vacīduccaritassa🔽kho pāpako vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañca, manoduccaritassa kho pāpako
analyzed: idha bhikkhave ekaccaḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati  kāya duccaritassa kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca vacī duccaritassa  kho pāpakaḥ vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyañca manaḥ duccaritassa kho pāpakaḥ
translated: Here someone reflects thus:

original: vipāko diṭṭhe ceva dhamme abhisamparāyañcā’ti.🔽So iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāyaduccaritaṁ pahāya kāyasucaritaṁ bhāveti, vacīduccaritaṁ pahāya
analyzed: vipākaḥ diṭṭhe ca iva dhamme abhisamparāyan ca ati  so iti paṭisaṅkhāya kāya duccaritam pahāya kāya su caritam bhāva iti vacī duccaritam pahāya
translated: ‘Evil unwholesome states with misconduct as condition have been abandoned in me; the unwholesome, with wrong concentration as condition have been abandoned in me; the unwholesome, with wrong knowledge as condition have been abandoned in me; the unwholesome, with wrong deliverance as condition have been abandoned in me.’🔽Having reflected thus, he abandons evil unwholesome states with misconduct as condition … with wrong concentration as condition … with wrong knowledge as condition … with wrong deliverance as condition.

original: vacīsucaritaṁ bhāveti, manoduccaritaṁ pahāya manosucaritaṁ bhāveti, suddhaṁ attānaṁ pariharati.
analyzed: vacī su caritam bhāva iti manaḥ duccaritam pahāya manaḥ su caritam bhāva iti suddham attānam pariharati
translated: He maintains himself in purity.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave paṭisaṅkhāna bala
translated: This is called the power of reflection.

analyzed: katamat ca bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the power of development?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.🔽Pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajāno, sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti,
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu vivicca iva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi sa vitakkam sa vicāram viveka jam pīti sukham paṭhamam jhānam upasampajja viharati  vitakka vicārānam vūpasamāḥ ajjhattam sampasādanam cetasaḥ eka udi bhāvam a vitakkam a vicāram samādhi jam pīti sukham dutiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati  pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sataḥ ca sampajāno sukham ca kāyena paṭisavedeti
translated: “Here, bhikkhus, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unwholesome states, a bhikkhu enters upon and abides in the first jhana, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of seclusion.🔽With the stilling of applied and sustained thought, he enters upon and abides in the second jhana, which has self-confidence and singleness of mind without applied and sustained thought, with rapture and pleasure born of concentration.

original: yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: yam tam ariyāḥ ācikkhanti upekkhakaḥ satimā sukha vihārī iti tatiyam jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the fading away as well of rapture, he abides in equanimity, and mindful and fully aware, still feeling pleasure with the body, he enters upon and abides in the third jhana, on account of which noble ones announce: ‘He has a pleasant abiding who has equanimity and is mindful.’

original: Sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbā iva somanassa domanassānam atthaṅgamā adukkham asukham upekkhā sati pārisuddhim catuttham jhānam upasampajja viharati
translated: With the abandoning of pleasure and pain, and with the previous disappearance of joy and grief, he enters upon and abides in the fourth jhana, which has neither-pain-nor-pleasure and purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.

analyzed: idam vuccati bhikkhave bhāvanā bala
translated: This is called the strength of development.

analyzed: imāni kho bhikkhave dve balāni iti
translated: These are the two powers.”

analyzed: dve mā bhikkhave tathāgatassa dhamma desanā
translated: “Monks, there are these two ways of teaching the Dhamma by the Tathāgata.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: saṅkhittena ca vitthārena ca
translated: In brief and in detail.

original: Imā kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgatassa dhammadesanā”ti.
analyzed: imā kho bhikkhave dve tathāgatassa dhamma desanā ti
translated: These are the two ways of teaching the Dhamma by the Tathāgata.”

original: “Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu na sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ:
analyzed: yasmi bhikkhave adhikaraṇe āpannaḥ ca bhikkhu codakaḥ ca bhikkhu na sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkha
translated: “Monks, in regard to any legal issue that arises, if the monk who has committed the offense and the monk who is accusing him do not carefully review themselves,

original: ‘dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca na phāsuṁ viharissantī’ti.
analyzed: dīgha ttāya khara ttāya vāḷa ttāya savattissati bhikkhū ca na phāsum viharissanti iti
translated: then that legal issue will lead to escalation, to bitterness or hatred, and the monks will not live comfortably.

original: Yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ:
analyzed: yasmin ca kho bhikkhave adhikaraṇe āpannaḥ ca bhikkhu codakaḥ ca bhikkhu sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkha
translated: But in regard to any legal issue that arises, if the monk who has committed the offense and the monk who is accusing him carefully review themselves,

original: ‘na dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca phāsuṁ viharissantī’ti.
analyzed: na dīgha ttāya khara ttāya vāḷa ttāya savattissati bhikkhū ca phāsum viharissanti iti
translated: then that legal issue will not lead to escalation, to bitterness or hatred, and the monks will live comfortably.”

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, āpanno bhikkhu sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave āpannaḥ bhikkhu sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati
translated: “And how does a monk who has fallen into an offense reflect properly upon himself?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, āpanno bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave āpannaḥ bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Here, a monk who has fallen into an offense reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ kho akusalaṁ āpanno kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: aham kho akusalam āpanno kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: ‘I have fallen into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension.

original: Maṁ so bhikkhu addasa akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.🔽No ce ahaṁ akusalaṁ āpajjeyyaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena, na maṁ so bhikkhu passeyya akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: mam saḥ bhikkhu addasa akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena  no ce aham akusalam āpajjeyyam kañcid eva desam kāyena na mam saḥ bhikkhu passeyya akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: That monk saw me falling into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension.🔽If I had not fallen into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension, that monk would not have seen me falling into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension.

original: Yasmā ca kho, ahaṁ akusalaṁ āpanno kañcideva desaṁ kāyena, tasmā maṁ so bhikkhu addasa akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho aham akusalam āpanno kañcid eva desam kāyena tasmā mam saḥ bhikkhu addasa akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: But because I have fallen into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension, that monk saw me falling into an unwholesome offense entailing suspension.

original: Disvā ca pana maṁ so bhikkhu akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena anattamano ahosi.
analyzed: disvā ca pana mam saḥ bhikkhu akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena anatta manaḥ ahosi
translated: Having seen me, he was displeased.

original: Anattamano samāno anattamanavacanaṁ maṁ so bhikkhu avaca.
analyzed: anatta manaḥ samānaḥ anatta mana vacanam mam saḥ bhikkhu avaca
translated: Being displeased, he expressed displeasure to me.

original: Anattamanavacanāhaṁ tena bhikkhunā vutto samāno anattamano ahosiṁ.
analyzed: anattamana vacanā aham tena bhikkhunā vutto samānaḥ anattamanaḥ ahosi
translated: When he said this, I was displeased.

analyzed: anatta manaḥ samānaḥ paresam ārocesi
translated: Being displeased, I told others.

original: Iti mameva tattha accayo accagamā suṅkadāyakaṁva bhaṇḍasmin’ti.
analyzed: iti mama iva accayaḥ accagamā
translated: So I am the one who has erred and strayed like one who picks up what was discarded.”

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, āpanno bhikkhu sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave āpannaḥ bhikkhu sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati
translated: This is how a monk who has committed an offense should reflect on himself.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave codakaḥ bhikkhu sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati
translated: “And how should a monk who is accusing another reflect on himself?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave codakaḥ bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: Here a monk who is accusing another reflects thus:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho bhikkhu akusalaṁ āpanno kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: ayam kho bhikkhu akusalam āpanno kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: ‘This monk has committed an offense entailing suspension.

original: Ahaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ addasaṁ akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: aham imam bhikkhum addasam akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: I have seen him commit it.

original: No ce ayaṁ bhikkhu akusalaṁ āpajjeyya kañcideva desaṁ kāyena, nāhaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ passeyyaṁ akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: no ce ayam bhikkhu akusalam āpajjeyya kañcid eva desam kāyena na aham imam bhikkhum passeyyam akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: If he hadn’t committed that offense, I wouldn’t have seen him commit it.

original: Yasmā ca kho, ayaṁ bhikkhu akusalaṁ āpanno kañcideva desaṁ kāyena, tasmā ahaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ addasaṁ akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena.
analyzed: yasmā ca kho ayam bhikkhu akusalam āpanno kañcid eva desam kāyena tasmā aham imam bhikkhum addasam akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena
translated: But since this monk has committed an offense by body in a certain case, that’s why I saw him committing an offense by body in a certain case.

original: Disvā ca panāhaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ akusalaṁ āpajjamānaṁ kañcideva desaṁ kāyena anattamano ahosiṁ.🔽Anattamano samāno anattamanavacanāhaṁ imaṁ bhikkhuṁ avacaṁ.
analyzed: disvā ca pana aham imam bhikkhum akusalam āpajjamānam kañcid eva desam kāyena anatta manaḥ ahosi  anattamano samānaḥ anattamana vacana aham imam bhikkhum avaca
translated: And having seen him, I was displeased.🔽And being displeased, I spoke in dispraise.

original: Anattamanavacanāyaṁ bhikkhu mayā vutto samāno anattamano ahosi.
analyzed: anattamana vacanā ayam bhikkhu mayā vuttaḥ samānaḥ anattamanaḥ ahosi
translated: And when I had spoken in dispraise, he was displeased.

analyzed: anatta manaḥ samānaḥ paresam ārocesi
translated: And being displeased, he told others.

original: Iti mameva tattha accayo accagamā suṅkadāyakaṁva bhaṇḍasmin’ti.
analyzed: iti mama iva accayaḥ accagamā
translated: So I’m the one who’s at fault, like the one who takes back a gift.”

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, codako bhikkhu sādhukaṁ attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave codakaḥ bhikkhu sādhukam attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati
translated: This is how a monk accusing another should reflect on himself.

original: Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu na sādhukaṁ attanāva
analyzed: yasmi bhikkhave adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu na sādhukam
translated: If, in a legal issue, the accused monk and the accusing monk don’t reflect properly on themselves,

original: attānaṁ paccavekkhati tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ dīghattāya kharattāya
analyzed: attānam paccavekkhati tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkham dīgha ttāya khara ttāya
translated: It can be expected that this legal issue will lead to long-lasting hatred and hostility,

original: vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca na phāsuṁ viharissantīti.🔽Yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu sādhukaṁ
analyzed: vāḷattāya savattissati bhikkhū ca na phāsum viharissanti iti  yasmin ca kho bhikkhave adhikaraṇe āpanno ca bhikkhu codako ca bhikkhu
translated: and that the monks will not live comfortably.”🔽But when a legal issue is resolved by a monk who has committed an offense properly reflecting on himself,

original: attanāva attānaṁ paccavekkhati tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ na dīghattāya
analyzed: attanā ava attānam paccavekkhati tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkham na dīgha ttāya
translated: it can be expected that this legal issue will not lead to long-lasting hatred and hostility,

original: kharattāya vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca phāsuṁ viharissantī”ti.🔽Atha kho aññataro brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: kharattāya vāḷattāya savattissati bhikkhū ca phāsum viharissanti iti  atha kho aññataraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: and that the monks will live comfortably.”🔽Then a certain brahmin went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti iti
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell?”

original: “Adhammacariyāvisamacariyāhetu kho, brāhmaṇa, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: adhamma cariyā visama cariyā hetu kho brāhmaṇaḥ evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti iti
translated: “It’s because of unrighteous conduct, unrighteous practice, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a plane of deprivation, a bad destination, a lower realm, hell.”

original: “Ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: “What is the cause, Master Gotama, what is the reason why some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world?”

original: “Dhammacariyāsamacariyāhetu kho, brāhmaṇa, evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: dhamma cariyā sama cariyā hetu kho brāhmaṇaḥ evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: “It’s because of righteous conduct, right practice, that some beings here, with the breakup of the body, after death, reappear in a good destination, a heavenly world.”

analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama abhikkanta bho gotama
translated: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!

original: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: seyyathā api bho gotama nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: just as one might set up a lamp in a dark place, so that those with eyes might see what’s there.

original: evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā gotamena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: In the same way, Gotama, you have illuminated the Dhamma in many ways.

original: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aham bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.🔽Atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti  atha kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: May Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”🔽Then the brahmin Janussoni went to the Blessed One and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Blessed One:

original: “ko nu kho, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjantī”ti?🔽“Katattā ca, brāhmaṇa, akatattā ca.
analyzed: kaḥ nu kho bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti iti 🔽katattā ca brāhmaṇa a katattā ca
translated: “Master Gotama, what is the cause and condition why some beings here, on the dissolution of the body, after death, reappear in states of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell? “🔽“It is by reason of conduct not in accordance with the Dhamma, brahmin, by reason of unrighteous conduct, that on the dissolution of the body, after death, some beings reappear in states of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.”

original: Evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti iti
translated: So it is that some beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a world of misery, a hell.”

original: “Ko pana, bho gotama, hetu ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bho gotama hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena midhā ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what is the cause and condition why some beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good destination, a heavenly world?”

analyzed: katattā ca brāhmaṇa a katattā ca
translated: “It is, brahmin, because of what has been done and what has not been done.

original: Evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: So it is that some beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good destination, a heavenly world.”

original: “Na kho ahaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
analyzed: na kho aham imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham a vibhattassa vitthārena attham ājānāmi
translated: “I do not understand in detail the meaning of Master Gotama’s brief statement.

original: Sādhu me bhavaṁ gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā ahaṁ imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ ājāneyyan”ti.
analyzed: sādhu me bhavam gotamaḥ tathā dhammam desetu yathā aham imassa bhoto gotamassa saṅkhittena bhāsitassa vitthārena attham avibhattassa vitthārena attham ājāneyyanti
translated: It would be good if Master Gotama would teach me the Dhamma so that I might understand in detail the meaning of his brief statement.”

original: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi brāhmaṇa suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇo bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhoti kho jāṇussoṇi brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied.

analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Idha, brāhmaṇa, ekaccassa kāyaduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti kāyasucaritaṁ;
analyzed: idha brāhmaṇaḥ ekaccassa kāya duccaritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: “Here, brahmin, someone has practiced bodily good conduct, verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct.

original: vacīduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti vacīsucaritaṁ;🔽manoduccaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti manosucaritaṁ.
analyzed: vacī duccaritam katam hoti a katam hoti  katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: He has not practiced bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct.

original: Evaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, katattā ca akatattā ca evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjanti.
analyzed: evam kho brāhmaṇa kata ttā ca a kata ttā ca evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjanti
translated: Thus, brahmin, it is because of doing and because of not doing that, with the breakup of the body, after death, some beings reappear in a state of deprivation, in an unhappy destination, in perdition, even in hell.

original: Idha pana, brāhmaṇa, ekaccassa kāyasucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti kāyaduccaritaṁ;🔽vacīsucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti vacīduccaritaṁ;
analyzed: idha pana brāhmaṇaḥ ekaccassa kāya su caritam katam hoti a katam hoti kāya duccarita  vacīsu caritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: Here, brahmin, someone has practiced bodily good conduct, verbal good conduct, and mental good conduct.

original: manosucaritaṁ kataṁ hoti, akataṁ hoti manoduccaritaṁ.
analyzed: manaḥ su caritam katam hoti a katam hoti
translated: He has not practiced bodily misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct.

original: Evaṁ kho, brāhmaṇa, katattā ca akatattā ca evam’idhekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjantī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho brāhmaṇa kata ttā ca a kata ttā ca evam idha ekacce sattā kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjanti iti
translated: It is because of what has been done and what has not been done that some beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly world.”

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe… upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent! … From today let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnam khalu āyasmantam ānandam bhagavān etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Ananda approached the Lord; having approached, having greeted the Lord, he sat down at a respectful distance. As he was sitting down at a respectful distance, the venerable Ananda spoke thus to the Lord:

original: “ekaṁsenāhaṁ, ānanda, akaraṇīyaṁ vadāmi kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritan”ti.
analyzed: ānanda akaraṇīyam vadāmi kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam
translated: “I say, Ananda, that it is not possible by any means to describe the result of the Tathagata’s bodily good conduct, speech and thought.

original: “Yamidaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā ekaṁsena akaraṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ tasmiṁ akaraṇīye kayiramāne ko ādīnavo pāṭikaṅkho”ti?
analyzed: yam idam bhante bhagavatā eka sena a karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccaritam tasmin a karaṇīye kayiramāne kaḥ ādīnavaḥ pāṭikaṅkhoti
translated: “What is the reason, Lord, that the result of the Tathagata’s bodily good conduct, speech and thought cannot be described by any means?”

original: “Yamidaṁ, ānanda, mayā ekaṁsena akaraṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ tasmiṁ akaraṇīye kayiramāne ayaṁ ādīnavo pāṭikaṅkho—🔽attāpi attānaṁ upavadati,🔽anuvicca viññū garahanti,🔽pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati,🔽sammūḷho kālaṁ karoti,🔽kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.🔽Yamidaṁ, ānanda, mayā ekaṁsena akaraṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyaduccaritaṁ vacīduccaritaṁ manoduccaritaṁ tasmiṁ akaraṇīye kayiramāne ayaṁ ādīnavo pāṭikaṅkho”ti.
analyzed: yam idam ānanda mayā eka sena a karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccaritam tasmin a karaṇīye kayiramāne ayam ādīnavaḥ pāṭikaṅkhaḥ  attā api attānam upavadati  anuvicca viññū garahanti  pāpakaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhuggacchati  sammūḍhaḥ kālam karoti  kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā apāyam duggatim vinipātam nirayam upapajjati  yam idam ānanda mayā eka sena a karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya duccaritam vacī duccaritam manaḥ duccaritam tasmin a karaṇīye kayiramāne ayam ādīnavaḥ pāṭikaṅkhoti
translated: “Ānanda, when you do what I have declared should not be done, you can expect this kind of outcome.🔽You reproach yourself.🔽The discerning criticize you.🔽You get a bad reputation.🔽You die confused.🔽And when your body breaks up, after death, you’re reborn in a lower realm, a bad destination, a fallen state, hell.”🔽“Ānanda, when you do what I have declared should not be done, you can expect this kind of outcome.”🔽

original: “Ekaṁsenāhaṁ, ānanda, karaṇīyaṁ vadāmi kāyasucaritaṁ vacīsucaritaṁ manosucaritan”ti.
analyzed: ekasenā āha ānanda karaṇīyam vadāmi kāya su caritam vacī su caritam
translated: “Ānanda, when you do what shouldn’t be done—wrong conduct by body, speech, and mind—you can expect these disadvantages:

original: “Yamidaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā ekaṁsena karaṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyasucaritaṁ vacīsucaritaṁ manosucaritaṁ tasmiṁ karaṇīye kayiramāne ko ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho”ti?
analyzed: yam idam bhante bhagavatā eka sena karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya su caritam vacī su caritam manaḥ su caritam tasmin karaṇīye kayiramāne kaḥ ānisasaḥ pāṭikaṅkhoti
translated: “When that which should be done by one who has gone forth is done, what benefit can one expect?”

original: “Yamidaṁ, ānanda, mayā ekaṁsena karaṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyasucaritaṁ vacīsucaritaṁ manosucaritaṁ tasmiṁ karaṇīye kayiramāne ayaṁ ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho—
analyzed: yam idam ānanda mayā ekasena karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya su caritam vacī su caritam manaḥ su caritam tasmin karaṇīye ayam ānisasaḥ pāṭikaṅkhaḥ
translated: “When that which should be done by one who has gone forth is done, one can expect these benefits:

original: attāpi attānaṁ na upavadati,🔽anuvicca viññū pasaṁsanti,
analyzed: attā api attānam na upavadati  anuvicca viññū pasasanti
translated: one does not reproach oneself;🔽the wise praise one;

analyzed: kalyāṇaḥ kitti saddaḥ abbhut gacchati
translated: one’s good reputation spreads in all directions;

analyzed: a sammūḍhaḥ kālam karoti
translated: one dies unconfused;

original: kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapajjati
translated: and with the breakup of the body, after death, one is reborn in a good destination, in a heavenly world.

original: Yamidaṁ, ānanda, mayā ekaṁsena karaṇīyaṁ akkhātaṁ kāyasucaritaṁ vacīsucaritaṁ manosucaritaṁ tasmiṁ karaṇīye kayiramāne ayaṁ ānisaṁso pāṭikaṅkho”ti.
analyzed: yam idam ānanda mayā ekasena karaṇīyam akkhātam kāya su caritam vacī su caritam manaḥ su caritam tasmin karaṇīye ayam ānisasaḥ pāṭikaṅkhoti
translated: When that which should be done by one who has gone forth is done, one can expect these benefits.”

analyzed: akusala bhikkhave pajahatha
translated: “Monks, abandon the unskillful.

analyzed: sakkā bhikkhave akusalam pajahitu
translated: It’s possible to abandon the unskillful.

original: No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa akusalaṁ pajahituṁ, nāhaṁ evaṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: no ceda bhikkhave sakkā abhavissa akusalam pajahitu na aham evam vadeyya
translated: If it were impossible to abandon unwholesome states, I wouldn’t say so.

original: ‘akusalaṁ, bhikkhave, pajahathā’ti.🔽Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, sakkā akusalaṁ pajahituṁ tasmāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: akusala bhikkhave pajahatha ati  yasmai ca kho bhikkhave sakkā akusalam pajahitum tasmai aham evam vadāmi
translated: If it were impossible to give up what is unskillful, I wouldn’t say, ‘Give up what is unskillful.’

original: ‘akusalaṁ, bhikkhave, pajahathā’ti.🔽Akusalañca hidaṁ, bhikkhave, pahīnaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya saṁvatteyya nāhaṁ evaṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: akusala bhikkhave pajahatha ati  akusalam ca bhikkhave pahīnam ahitāya dukkhāya na aham evam vadeyya
translated: But because it is possible to give up what is unskillful, I say, ‘Give up what is unskillful.’

original: ‘akusalaṁ, bhikkhave, pajahathā’ti.🔽Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, akusalaṁ pahīnaṁ hitāya sukhāya saṁvattati tasmāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: akusala bhikkhave pajahatha ati  yasmā ca kho bhikkhave akusalam pahīnam hitāya sukhāya savattati tasmā aham evam vadāmi
translated: And if giving up what is unskillful led to harm & suffering, I wouldn’t say, ‘Give up what is unskillful.’

analyzed: akusala bhikkhave pajahatha ati
translated: But because giving up what is unskillful leads to benefit & happiness, I say, ‘Give up what is unskillful.’”

analyzed: kusala bhikkhave bhāvetha
translated: “Bhikkhus, develop what is skillful.

original: Sakkā, bhikkhave, kusalaṁ bhāvetuṁ.🔽No cedaṁ, bhikkhave, sakkā abhavissa kusalaṁ bhāvetuṁ, nāhaṁ evaṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: sakkā bhikkhave kusalam bhāvetu  no ceda bhikkhave sakkā abhavissa kusalam bhāvetu na aham evam vadeyya
translated: It is possible to develop what is skillful.🔽If it were impossible to develop what is skillful, I wouldn’t say, ‘Develop what is skillful.’

analyzed: kusala bhikkhave bhāvetha ati
translated: But because it is possible to develop what is skillful, I say, ‘Develop what is skillful.’

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, sakkā kusalaṁ bhāvetuṁ tasmāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave sakkā kusalam bhāvetum tasmā aham evam vadāmi
translated: But since it is possible to develop what is skillful, that’s why I say,

original: ‘kusalaṁ, bhikkhave, bhāvethā’ti.🔽Kusalañca hidaṁ, bhikkhave, bhāvitaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya saṁvatteyya, nāhaṁ evaṁ vadeyyaṁ:
analyzed: kusala bhikkhave bhāvetha ati  kusalam ca bhikkhave bhāvitam ahitāya dukkhāya na aham evam vadeyya
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, develop what is skillful.’

analyzed: kusala bhikkhave bhāvetha ati
translated: If what is skillful, when developed, would lead to harm & suffering, I wouldn’t say, ‘Develop what is skillful.’

original: Yasmā ca kho, bhikkhave, kusalaṁ bhāvitaṁ hitāya sukhāya saṁvattati tasmāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
analyzed: yasmā ca kho bhikkhave kusalam bhāvitam hitāya sukhāya savattati tasmā aham evam vadāmi
translated: But since what is skillful, when developed, leads to benefit & happiness, that’s why I say,

analyzed: kusala bhikkhave bhāvetha ati
translated: ‘Bhikkhus, develop what is skillful.’”

original: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattanti.
analyzed: dve me bhikkhave dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya savattanti
translated: “Monks, these two things lead to the disappearance & destruction of the true Dhamma.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: Which two?

analyzed: dunnikkhittam ca pada byañjanam atthaḥ ca dunnītaḥ
translated: The mis-apprehending of the phrasing & the mis-apprehending of the meaning.

original: Dunnikkhittassa, bhikkhave, padabyañjanassa atthopi dunnayo hoti.
analyzed: dunnikkhittassa bhikkhave pada byañjanassa atthaḥ api dunnayaḥ hoti
translated: When the phrasing is mis-apprehended, the meaning is mis-apprehended.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya saṁvattantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve dhammā saddhammassa sammosāya antaradhānāya savattanti iti
translated: These are the two things that lead to the disappearance & destruction of the true Dhamma.”

analyzed: dve me bhikkhave dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyāḥ asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattanti

analyzed: su nikkhittassa bhikkhave pada byañjanassa atthaḥ api su nayaḥ hoti
translated: When the words and letters are well-analyzed, the meaning is well-ascertained.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyā asammosāya anantaradhānāya saṁvattantī”ti.🔽Adhikaraṇavaggo dutiyo.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve dhammā saddhammassa ṭhitiyāḥ asammosāya anantaradhānāya savattanti iti  adhikaraṇa vaggo dutiyaḥ
translated: These are the two things that lead to the continuation, non-decline, and non-disappearance of the true Dhamma.”🔽The second sub-chapter on legal issues is finished.

translated: One who proclaims what has not been spoken or uttered by the Realised One as not having been spoken or uttered by the Realised One, and one who proclaims what has been spoken or uttered by the Realised One as having been spoken or uttered by the Realised One.

translated: These are the two who do not misrepresent the Tathāgata.”

translated: It leads to ignorance being abandoned.

original: Rāgupakkiliṭṭhaṁ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṁ na vimuccati, avijjupakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā na bhāvīyati.
analyzed: rāga upakkiliṭṭham vā bhikkhave cittam na vimuccati avijju upakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā na bhāvīyati
translated: “Bhikkhus, a mind defiled by passion is not liberated, and wisdom defiled by ignorance is not developed.

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī”ti.
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave rāga virāgā cetaḥ vimutti avijjā virāgā paññā vimutti iti
translated: So, bhikkhus, the liberation of mind by non-clinging comes through the fading away of passion, and the liberation by wisdom comes through the fading away of ignorance.”

analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave asappurisa bhūmi
translated: “And what is the level of the bad person?

analyzed: asappurisaḥ bhikkhave akataññū hoti akata vedī
translated: An untrue man is not grateful or thankful.

original: Asabbhi hetaṁ, bhikkhave, upaññātaṁ yadidaṁ akataññutā akataveditā.
analyzed: asabbhi heta bhikkhave upaññātam yat idam akataññu tā akata vedi tā
translated: This is the way of the untrue: not being grateful or thankful.

original: Kevalā esā, bhikkhave, asappurisabhūmi yadidaṁ akataññutā akataveditā. (…)
analyzed: kevalā esā bhikkhave a sappurisa bhūmi yat idam akataññu tā akata vedi tā
translated: This is the level of the untrue: not being grateful or thankful. …

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, kataññū hoti katavedī.🔽Sabbhi hetaṁ, bhikkhave, upaññātaṁ yadidaṁ kataññutā kataveditā.
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave kataññū hoti kata vedī  sabbhi ha ita bhikkhave upaññātam yat idam kataññu tā kata vedi tā
translated: A true man is grateful and thankful.🔽This is the way of the true: being grateful and thankful.

original: Kevalā esā, bhikkhave, sappurisabhūmi yadidaṁ kataññutā kataveditā”ti.
analyzed: kevalā esā bhikkhave sappurisa bhūmi yat idam kataññu tā kata veditā ati
translated: This is the level of the true: being grateful and thankful.”

analyzed: bhikkhave na suppatikāram vadāmi
translated: “I say that there are two who are not to be repaid.

analyzed: katamesam dvinna
translated: Who are the two?

analyzed: mātu ca pitu ca
translated: Mother and father.

original: Ekena, bhikkhave, aṁsena mātaraṁ parihareyya, ekena aṁsena pitaraṁ parihareyya vassasatāyuko vassasatajīvī so ca nesaṁ ucchādanaparimaddananhāpanasambāhanena.
analyzed: ekena bhikkhave asena mātaram parihareyya ekena asena pitaram parihareyya vassa sata āyukaḥ vassa sata jīvī saḥ ca nesam ucchādana parimaddana nhāpana sambāhanena
translated: Even if you were to carry your mother on one shoulder and your father on the other shoulder for a hundred years, and they would say to you, ‘Now rub us with this,’ even if you were to do that, you still would not have done enough for your parents, nor would you have repaid them.

original: Te ca tattheva muttakarīsaṁ cajeyyuṁ, na tveva, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṁ kataṁ vā hoti paṭikataṁ vā.
analyzed: te ca tattha iva mutta karīsam cajeyyu na tu eva bhikkhave mātā pitūnam katam vā hoti paṭikatam vā
translated: And even if they were to relieve their parents of the need to defecate and urinate, still they would not have done what needed to be done for their parents.

original: Imissā ca, bhikkhave, mahāpathaviyā pahūtarattaratanāya mātāpitaro issarādhipacce rajje patiṭṭhāpeyya, na tveva, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṁ kataṁ vā hoti paṭikataṁ vā.
analyzed: imissā ca bhikkhave mahā pathaviyā pahūta ratta ratanāya mātā pitaraḥ issara adhipacce rajje patiṭṭhāpeyya na tu eva bhikkhave mātā pitūnam katam vā hoti paṭikatam vā
translated: And even if they were to establish their parents as lords over this great earth, rich and prosperous, still they would not have done what needed to be done for their parents.

analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: Why is that?

original: Bahukārā, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro puttānaṁ āpādakā posakā imassa lokassa dassetāro.
analyzed: bahu kārāḥ bhikkhave mātā pitaro puttānaṃ āpādakāḥ posakāḥ imassa lokassa dassetāraḥ
translated: Parents are very helpful to their children, nursing them, caring for them, and showing them the world.

original: Yo ca kho, bhikkhave, mātāpitaro assaddhe saddhāsampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti,
analyzed: yaḥ ca kho bhikkhave mātā pitaro assaddhe saddhā sampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti
translated: “If a child encourages their parents who lack faith to acquire faith,

original: dussīle sīlasampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti, maccharī cāgasampadāya samādapeti
analyzed: dussīle sīla sampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti maccharī cāga sampadāya samādapeti
translated: who are immoral to acquire moral discipline, who are stingy to give gifts,

original: niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti, duppaññe paññāsampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti,
analyzed: niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti duppaññe paññā sampadāya samādapeti niveseti patiṭṭhāpeti
translated: and who are unwise to acquire wisdom,

original: ettāvatā kho, bhikkhave, mātāpitūnaṁ katañca hoti paṭikatañcā”ti.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho bhikkhave mātā pitūnam katam ca hoti paṭikatam ca ati
translated: to the same extent they have done what needed to be done for their parents.”

original: Atha kho aññataro brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi. Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ …pe… ekamantaṁ nisinno kho so brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham pe ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then a certain brahmin went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

analyzed: ki vādī bhavam gotamaḥ kim akkhāyi iti
translated: “What does Master Gotama say about this?”

analyzed: kiriya vādī ca āha brāhmaṇa akiriya vādī ca ati
translated: “Brahmin, I say that there is action and that there is no action.”

original: “Yathākathaṁ pana bhavaṁ gotamo kiriyavādī ca akiriyavādī cā”ti?
analyzed: yathākatham pana bhavam gotamo kiriya vādī ca akiriya vādī ca ati
translated: “But how is it, Master Gotama, that you say that there is action and that there is no action?”

original: “Akiriyaṁ kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vadāmi kāyaduccaritassa vacīduccaritassa manoduccaritassa, anekavihitānaṁ pāpakānaṁ akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ akiriyaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: akiriyam kho aha brāhmaṇa vadāmi kāya duccaritassa vacī duccaritassa manaḥ duccaritassa aneka vihitānam pāpakānam akusalānam dhammānam akiriyam vadāmi
translated: “Brahmin, I say that there is no doing of evil by way of body, speech, and mind. I say that there is no doing of the many kinds of evil unwholesome deeds.

original: Kiriyañca kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, vadāmi kāyasucaritassa vacīsucaritassa manosucaritassa, anekavihitānaṁ kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ kiriyaṁ vadāmi.
analyzed: kiriyam ca kho aha brāhmaṇa vadāmi kāya su caritassa vacī su caritassa manaḥ su caritassa aneka vihitānam kusalānam dhammānam kiriyam vadāmi
translated: I say that there is doing by way of body, speech, and mind. I say that there is doing of the many kinds of wholesome deeds.

original: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, brāhmaṇa, kiriyavādī ca akiriyavādī cā”ti.
analyzed: evam kho aha brāhmaṇa kiriya vādī ca a kiriya vādī ca ati
translated: That is how I say that there is action and that there is no action.”

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama …pe… upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho gotama pe upāsakam mam bhavam gotamaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: “Magnificent, Master Gotama! Magnificent! Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms, in the same way has Master Gotama—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear. I go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.🔽Then the householder Anathapindika went to the Blessed One and,

original: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ🔽abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavanta  abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu anāthapiṇḍikaḥ gahapati bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: on arrival, having bowed down to him, sat to one side. As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: “kati nu kho, bhante, loke dakkhiṇeyyā, kattha ca dānaṁ dātabban”ti?
analyzed: kati nu kho bhante loke dakkhiṇeyyā kattha ca dānam dātabbanti
translated: “How many, lord, are the ones in the world worthy of offerings? Where is a gift to be given?”

analyzed: dve kho gahapati loke dakkhiṇeyyā
translated: “There are two, householder, in the world worthy of offerings,

analyzed: sekhaḥ ca asekhaḥ ca
translated: where a gift is to be given.

original: Ime kho, gahapati, dve loke dakkhiṇeyyā, ettha ca dānaṁ dātabban”ti.
analyzed: ime kho gahapati dve loke dakkhiṇeyyāḥ ettha ca dānam dātabbanti
translated: These are the two in the world worthy of offerings, where a gift is to be given.”

analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This was said by the Blessed One.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ atha aparam etat avoca satthā
translated: Having said this, the One Well-Gone, the Teacher, further said this:

analyzed: sekhaḥ asekhaḥ ca imasmin loke
translated: “The one in training and the one beyond training in the world

analyzed: āhuneyyā yajamānānam honti
translated: are worthy of offerings for those making merit.

analyzed: te ujjubhūtā kāyena
translated: They are upright in body,

analyzed: vācāya uda cetasā
translated: in speech, and in mind.

analyzed: khettam tam
translated: They are a field of merit for those making merit,

analyzed: ettha dinnam
translated: Whatever is given to them is of great fruit.”

analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard:

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto sāvatthiyaṁ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena āyasmā sāriputto sāvatthiyam viharati pubbārāme migāra mātupāsāde
translated: Now on that occasion the venerable Sāriputta was dwelling at Sāvatthī in the Eastern Monastery, in Migāramātā’s mansion.

original: Tatra kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho āyasmā sāriputtaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the venerable Sāriputta addressed the bhikkhus thus:

analyzed: āvuso bhikkhave ti
translated: “Friends, bhikkhus.”

original: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa
translated: “Friend,” those bhikkhus replied.

analyzed: āyasmā sāriputtaḥ etat avoca
translated: The venerable Sāriputta said this:

analyzed: ajjhatta sayojanam ca āvuso puggalam desessāmi bahiddhā sayojanam ca
translated: “Friends, I will teach you the person subject to tormentation internally and the person subject to tormentation externally.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: evam āvuso ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato sāriputtassa
translated: “Yes, friend,” those bhikkhus replied.

analyzed: āyasmā sāriputtaḥ etat avoca
translated: The venerable Sāriputta said this:

analyzed: katamaḥ ca āvuso ajjhatta sayojanaḥ puggalo
translated: “And what, friends, is the person subject to tormentation internally?

original: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno, aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: idha āvuso bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: There is the case where a monk is virtuous, restrained in the monastic code, and trains himself in the framework of the training rules.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā aññataraṁ devanikāyaṁ upapajjati.🔽So tato cuto āgāmī hoti, āgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā aññataram devanikāyam upapajjati  saḥ tatas cutaḥ āgāmī hoti āgantā
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the devas who delight in creation.🔽Having come back from there, he comes back to this human state.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, āvuso, ajjhattasaṁyojano puggalo āgāmī hoti, āgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: ayam vuccati āvuso ajjhatta sayojanaḥ puggalo āgāmī hoti āgantā itthatta
translated: This is called a person internally bound who is a once-returner, coming back to this human state once, and then making an end of suffering.

original: Katamo cāvuso, bahiddhāsaṁyojano puggalo?🔽Idhāvuso, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharati ācāragocarasampanno, aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: katamaḥ ca āvuso bahiddhā sayojanaḥ puggalo  idha āvuso bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu
translated: “And which is the person externally bound?🔽There is the case where a monk is virtuous, restrained in the monastic code, and trains himself in the framework of the training rules.

original: So aññataraṁ santaṁ cetovimuttiṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: so aññataram santam cetaḥ vimuttim upasampajja viharati
translated: He enters & remains in the first jhāna: rapture & pleasure born of seclusion, accompanied by directed thought & evaluation.

original: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā aññataraṁ devanikāyaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā aññataram devanikāyam upapajjati
translated: With the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with the devas who delight in creation.

original: So tato cuto anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ anāgāmī hoti anāgantā
translated: Having come back from there, he is not coming back to this human state.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatāvuso, bahiddhāsaṁyojano puggalo anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: ayam vuccati avuso bahiddhā sayojanaḥ puggalo anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthatta
translated: This is called a person bound externally who is a non-returner, not subject to return to this world.🔽“And further, there is the case where a monk is virtuous …

original: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu sīlavā hoti …pe… samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu.🔽So kāmānaṁyeva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.🔽So bhavānaṁyeva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
analyzed: puna caparaḥ āvuso bhikkhu sīlavā hoti pe samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu  so kāmānayā iva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannaḥ hoti  so bhavānayā iva nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: he practices for disenchantment with regard to forms …🔽he practices for disenchantment with regard to feelings …🔽he practices for disenchantment with regard to perceptions …

analyzed: so taṇhā khayāya paṭipannaḥ hoti
translated: he practices for disenchantment with regard to fabrications …

original: So lobhakkhayāya paṭipanno hoti.🔽So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā aññataraṁ devanikāyaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: so lobha kkhayāya paṭipannaḥ hoti  so kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā aññataram devanikāyam upapajjati
translated: he practices for disenchantment with regard to consciousness.

original: So tato cuto anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattaṁ.
analyzed: saḥ tatas cutaḥ anāgāmī hoti anāgantā
translated: With the ending of effluents, he is one of spontaneous birth, due to attain final nibbana there without returning from that world.

original: Ayaṁ vuccatāvuso, bahiddhāsaṁyojano puggalo anāgāmī hoti, anāgantā itthattan”ti.
analyzed: ayam vuccati avuso bahiddhā sayojanaḥ puggalaḥ anāgāmī hoti anāgantā itthattanti
