translated: This is called a person bound externally who is a non-returner, not subject to return to this world.”

original: Atha kho sambahulā samacittā devatā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho tā devatā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: atha kho sambahulā sama cittāḥ devatāḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamantam ṭhitāḥ kho tāḥ devatāḥ bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: Then a number of deities of the same mind went to the Blessed One, and after paying homage to him, they stood at one side and said to him:

original: “eso, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde bhikkhūnaṁ ajjhattasaṁyojanañca puggalaṁ deseti bahiddhāsaṁyojanañca.
analyzed: esaḥ bhante āyasmā sāriputto pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde bhikkhūnam ajjhatta sayojanam ca puggalam deseti bahiddhā sayojanam ca
translated: “Venerable sir, the venerable Sariputta, in the public meeting hall, is giving this Dhamma talk to the bhikkhus:

analyzed: haṭṭhā bhante parisā
translated: ‘Friends, bhikkhus.’

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā yena ayasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would go to the public meeting hall out of compassion for those bhikkhus.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.🔽Atha kho bhagavā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena  atha khalu bhagavān aseyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasārita
translated: The Blessed One consented in silence.

original: vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evamevaṁ—jetavane antarahito pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde āyasmato🔽sāriputtassa sammukhe pāturahosi.
analyzed: vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva jetavane antarahitaḥ pubba ārāme migāra mātu pāsāde āyasmataḥ  sāriputtassa sammukhe pāturahosi
translated: Then the Blessed One, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, disappeared from the Jeta Grove and reappeared in the public meeting hall in the Eastern Park.

analyzed: nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane
translated: He sat down on the seat made ready and said to the venerable Sariputta:🔽“Good, good, Sariputta!

original: Āyasmāpi kho sāriputto bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: āyasmā api kho sāriputtaḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and the venerable Sāriputta also bowed down to the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:🔽“Idha, sāriputta, sambahulā samacittā devatā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, sāriputta, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam khalu āyasmantam sāriputtam bhagavān etat avoca  idha sāriputta sambahulā sama cittāḥ devatāḥ yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamantam ṭhitāḥ kho sāriputta tāḥ devatāḥ mam etat avocuḥ
translated: The Blessed One said to him:🔽“Here, Sāriputta, a number of deities came to me, bowed, stood to one side,

original: ‘eso, bhante, āyasmā sāriputto pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde bhikkhūnaṁ ajjhattasaṁyojanañca puggalaṁ deseti bahiddhāsaṁyojanañca.
analyzed: esaḥ bhante āyasmā sāriputto pubbārāme migāra mātu pāsāde bhikkhūnam ajjhatta sayojanam ca puggalam deseti bahiddhā sayojanam ca
translated: and said: ‘Venerable sir, the venerable Sāriputta is teaching the Dhamma to the bhikkhus in the public hall, describing the person immersed in worldly pleasures as “immersed in worldly pleasures” and the person freed from worldly pleasures as “freed from worldly pleasures.”

analyzed: haṭṭhā bhante parisā
translated: The assembly is delighted.

original: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā yena āyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā’ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante bhagavā yena āyasmā sāriputto tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would approach the venerable Sāriputta out of compassion for him.’

original: Tā kho pana, sāriputta, devatā dasapi hutvā vīsampi hutvā tiṁsampi hutvā cattālīsampi
analyzed: tāḥ kho pana sāriputta devatāḥ dasa pi hutvā vīsampi hutvā tisampi hutvā cattālīsampi
translated: Then, Sāriputta, those deities, ten or twenty or thirty of them,

original: hutvā paññāsampi hutvā saṭṭhipi hutvā āraggakoṭinitudanamattepi tiṭṭhanti, na ca
analyzed: hutvā paññāsam pi hutvā saṭṭhi pi hutvā āragga koṭi nitudana matte pi tiṭṭhanti na ca
translated: and having become fifty, and having become sixty, they stand on the tip of a hair’s B103🔽

analyzed: aññam aññam byābādhenti
translated: and they stand there without crowding each other.

original: Siyā kho pana, sāriputta, evamassa:🔽‘tattha nūna tāsaṁ devatānaṁ tathā cittaṁ bhāvitaṁ yena tā devatā dasapi hutvā vīsampi🔽hutvā tiṁsampi hutvā cattālīsampi hutvā paññāsampi hutvā saṭṭhipi hutvā āraggakoṭinitudanamattepi
analyzed: siyā kho pana sāriputta evam assa  tattha nūna tāsam devatānam tathā cittam bhāvitam yena tāḥ devatāḥ dasa pi hutvā  hutvā tisam pi hutvā cattālīsam pi hutvā paññāsam pi hutvā saṭṭhi pi hutvā āragga koṭi nitudana matte pi
translated: Sāriputta, you may think:

analyzed: tiṭṭhanti na ca aññam aññam byābādhenti iti
translated: ‘Surely, those deities have developed their minds in such a way that they can stand there without crowding each other.’

original: Na kho panetaṁ, sāriputta, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
analyzed: na kho pana ita sāriputta evam daṭṭhabba
translated: But you should not regard it in this way.

original: Idheva kho, sāriputta, tāsaṁ devatānaṁ tathā cittaṁ bhāvitaṁ, yena tā devatā dasapi hutvā …pe… na ca aññamaññaṁ byābādhenti.
analyzed: idha iva kho sāriputta tāsam devatānam tathā cittam bhāvita yena tāḥ devatāḥ hutvā pe na ca aññam aññam byābādhenti
translated: It is right here that those deities have developed their minds in such a way that they can stand there without crowding each other.

analyzed: tasmā ati ha sāriputta evam
translated: Therefore, Sāriputta, you should train yourselves thus:

analyzed: santi indriyāḥ bhavissāma santa mānasā ati
translated: ‘We will be moderate in our desires and contented.’

analyzed: evam hi vaḥ sāriputta sikkhitabba
translated: It is in such a way, Sāriputta, that you should train yourselves.

original: ‘Santindriyānañhi vo, sāriputta, santamānasānaṁ santaṁyeva kāyakammaṁ bhavissati santaṁ vacīkammaṁ santaṁ manokammaṁ.
analyzed: santa indriyānam hi vaḥ sāriputta santa mānasānam santayā iva kāya kammam bhavissati santam vacī kammam santam manaḥ kamma
translated: ‘Sāriputta, you should train like this: “We will have peaceful bodily actions, peaceful verbal actions, and peaceful mental actions.

analyzed: upahāram upaharissāma sabrahmacārīsu iti
translated: We will make peaceful offerings to our companions in the holy life.”

analyzed: evam hi vaḥ sāriputta sikkhitabba
translated: ‘Sāriputta, you should train like this.

original: Anassuṁ kho, sāriputta, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā ye imaṁ dhammapariyāyaṁ nāssosun’”ti.
analyzed: anassum kho sāriputta añña titthiyāḥ paribbājakāḥ ye imam dhammapariyāyam na assosunti
translated: The monastics of other religions will not be able to find any fault with you in regard to this teaching.’”

analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā mahākaccāno varaṇāyaṁ viharati bhaddasāritīre.
analyzed: ekam samayam āyasmā mahākaccānaḥ varaṇāyam viharati bhaddasāri tīre
translated: On one occasion the Venerable Maha Kaccana was dwelling at Varaṇā on the bank of the Kaddama Lake.

original: Atha kho ārāmadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho ārāmadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena āyasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhim sammodi
translated: Then the brahmin Aramadanda approached the Venerable Maha Kaccana and exchanged greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho ārāmadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho ārāmadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ āyasmantam mahākaccānam etat avoca
translated: When this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side and said to the Venerable Maha Kaccana:

original: “ko nu kho, bho kaccāna, hetu ko paccayo yena khattiyāpi khattiyehi vivadanti, brāhmaṇāpi brāhmaṇehi vivadanti, gahapatikāpi gahapatikehi vivadantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khalu bho kaccāna hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena khattiyā api khattiyehi vivadanti brāhmaṇā api brāhmaṇehi vivadanti gahapatikā api gahapatikehi vivadanti iti
translated: “What is the reason, Master Kaccāna, why nobles fight with nobles, brahmins with brahmins, and householders with householders?”

analyzed: kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna hetu kho brāhmaṇa khattiya api
translated: “It is, brahmin, because of passion, delight, and craving for sensual pleasures

original: khattiyehi vivadanti, brāhmaṇāpi brāhmaṇehi vivadanti, gahapatikāpi gahapatikehi vivadantī”ti.
analyzed: khattiyehi vivadanti brāhmaṇā api brāhmaṇehi vivadanti gahapatikā api gahapatikehi vivadanti iti
translated: that nobles fight with nobles, brahmins with brahmins, and householders with householders.”

original: “Ko pana, bho kaccāna, hetu ko paccayo yena samaṇāpi samaṇehi vivadantī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana bho kaccāna hetu kaḥ paccayaḥ yena samaṇā api samaṇehi vivadanti iti
translated: “What is the reason, Master Kaccāna, why contemplatives fight with contemplatives?”🔽“It is, brahmin, because of passion, delight, and craving for views, because of insisting, insisting strongly, insisting utterly strongly, on views,🔽because of grasping, grasping strongly, grasping utterly strongly, after views,🔽because of being attached, being attached strongly, being attached utterly strongly, to views,🔽because of being infatuated, being infatuated strongly, being infatuated utterly strongly, with views,🔽because of being obsessed, being obsessed strongly, being obsessed utterly strongly, with views,

original: “Diṭṭhirāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānahetu kho, brāhmaṇa, samaṇāpi samaṇehi vivadantī”ti.🔽“Atthi pana, bho kaccāna, koci lokasmiṁ yo imañceva kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānaṁ
analyzed: diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna hetu kho brāhmaṇa samaṇa api samaṇehi vivadanti iti 🔽atthi pana bho kaccāna koci lokasmin imam ca iva kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna
translated: that contemplatives fight with contemplatives.”

analyzed: samatikkantaḥ imam ca diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosānam samatikkantaḥ iti
translated: and he has gone beyond attachment to views about the body and sensual pleasures?”

original: “Atthi, brāhmaṇa, lokasmiṁ yo imañceva kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānaṁ🔽samatikkanto, imañca diṭṭhirāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānaṁ samatikkanto”ti.🔽“Ko pana so, bho kaccāna, lokasmiṁ yo imañceva kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānaṁ
analyzed: atthi brāhmaṇa lokasmiṃ yaḥ imam ca iva kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna  samatikkantaḥ imam ca diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosānam samatikkantaḥ iti  kaḥ pana saḥ bho kaccāna lokasmim imam ca eva kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna
translated: “There is, brahmin.”

analyzed: samatikkantaḥ imam ca diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosānam samatikkantaḥ iti
translated: “But who, Master Kaccāna, has gone beyond attachment to sensual pleasures and attachment to views?”

original: “Atthi, brāhmaṇa, puratthimesu janapadesu sāvatthī nāma nagaraṁ.
analyzed: atthi brāhmaṇa puratthimesu janapadesu sāvatthī nāma nagara
translated: “There is, brahmin, a city in the northern country named Sāvatthī.

original: Tattha so bhagavā etarahi viharati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho.
analyzed: tattha saḥ bhagavā etarahi viharati araham sammāsambuddhaḥ
translated: There the Blessed One now dwells, accomplished and fully enlightened.

analyzed: saḥ hi brāhmaṇa bhagavā imam ca eva kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna
translated: For the Blessed One, brahmin, has abandoned and cut off craving, the fetter, and the underlying tendency to craving for sensual pleasures.

analyzed: samatikkantaḥ imam ca diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosānam samatikkantaḥ iti
translated: For the Blessed One has overcome attachment to sensual pleasures, overcome attachment to views, overcome attachment to virtue and practice, overcome attachment to conceit, overcome attachment to passion, overcome attachment to conceit, overcome attachment to ignorance, overcome attachment to delight and affection, overcome attachment to craving, overcome attachment to existence, overcome attachment to conceit, overcome attachment to the conceit ‘I am,’ overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to conceit, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to passion, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to aversion, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to views, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to doubt, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to conceit, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to lust, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to anger, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to the false view of personality, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to craving for existence, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to conceit, overcome attachment to the underlying tendency to ignorance.🔽He has overcome attachment to the world, attachment to becoming, attachment to bondage, attachment to the fetters, attachment to the underlying tendencies, attachment to the aggregates, attachment to the sense bases, attachment to the elements, attachment to the round, attachment to the underlying causes, attachment to craving, attachment to defilement, attachment to kamma, attachment to rebirth, attachment to birth, attachment to aging, attachment to death, attachment to sorrow, lamentation, pain, displeasure, and despair.

original: Evaṁ vutte, ārāmadaṇḍo brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā dakkhiṇaṁ jāṇumaṇḍalaṁ pathaviyaṁ nihantvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
analyzed: evam vutte ārāmadaṇḍaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā dakkhiṇam jāṇu maṇḍalam pathaviyam nihantvā yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā tikkhattum udānam udānesi
translated: He has overcome attachment to suffering, attachment to origination, attachment to cessation, attachment to the path, attachment to the conditioned, attachment to the unconditioned, attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.🔽He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.🔽He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.

original: “Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.🔽He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.

original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa.🔽Yo hi so bhagavā imañceva kāmarāgābhinivesavinibandhapaligedhapariyuṭṭhānajjhosānaṁ
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa  yaḥ hi saḥ bhagavā imam ca eva kāma rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosāna
translated: He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.🔽He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.

analyzed: samatikkantaḥ imam ca diṭṭhi rāga abhinivesa vinibandha paligedha pariyuṭṭhāna ajjhosānam samatikkantaḥ iti
translated: He has overcome attachment to the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, and explored.🔽He has

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bho kaccāna, abhikkantaṁ, bho kaccāna.🔽Seyyathāpi, bho kaccāna, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: abhikkanta bho kaccāna abhikkanta bho kaccāna  seyyathā api bho kaccāna nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: “Excellent, Master Kaccana! Excellent! …

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya; andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: evamevaṁ bhotā kaccānena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhotā kaccā anena aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: in the same way has Master Kaccana—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.

original: Esāhaṁ, bho kaccāna, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bho kaccāna tam bhavantam gotamam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammam ca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: I go to Master Gotama for refuge, to the Dhamma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ kaccāno dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhavam kaccānaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May Master Kaccāna remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Ekaṁ samayaṁ āyasmā mahākaccāno madhurāyaṁ viharati gundāvane.🔽Atha kho kandarāyano brāhmaṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: ekam samayam mahākaccānaḥ viharati gundāvane  atha kho kandarāyanaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ yena ayasmā mahākaccāno tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā
translated: On one occasion the Venerable Maha Kaccana was dwelling at Madhura in the Gundas Cave.🔽Then the brahmin Kandarayana approached the Venerable Maha Kaccana and exchanged greetings with him.

original: āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhiṁ …pe… ekamantaṁ nisinno kho kandarāyano brāhmaṇo āyasmantaṁ
analyzed: āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhim pe ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho kandarāyanaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: When they had concluded their greetings and cordial talk, he sat down to one side and said to the Venerable Maha Kaccana:🔽“Master Kaccana, it is said that Master Kaccana is able to expound the omniscient knowledge of the brahmins and to reveal, describe, and teach it.

analyzed: mahākaccānam etat avoca
translated: and said this to Mahā Kaccāna:

original: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho kaccāna, ‘na samaṇo kaccāno brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimantetī’ti.
analyzed: sutam mā ita bho kaccāna na samaṇaḥ kaccānaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti iti
translated: “Master Kaccāna, I have heard that Master Kaccāna does not pay respect to old brāhmaṇas, does not stand up for them, and does not offer them a seat.

analyzed: tayida bho kaccāna tathā iva
translated: Is that right?

original: Na hi bhavaṁ kaccāno brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addhagate vayoanuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti.
analyzed: na hi bhavam kaccānaḥ brāhmaṇe jiṇṇe vuddhe mahallake addha gate vayaḥ anuppatte abhivādeti vā paccuṭṭheti vā āsanena vā nimanteti
translated: Master Kaccāna does not pay respect to old brāhmaṇas, does not stand up for them, and does not offer them a seat.

analyzed: bho kaccāna na sampannam eva ati
translated: That is not right.”

original: “Atthi, brāhmaṇa, tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena vuddhabhūmi ca akkhātā daharabhūmi ca.
analyzed: atthi brāhmaṇa tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena vuddha bhūmi ca akkhātā dahara bhūmi ca
translated: “Brahmin, the Buddha, the Perfected and fully Awakened One, has explained the stage of the elder and the stage of the youth.

original: Vuddho cepi, brāhmaṇa, hoti āsītiko vā nāvutiko vā vassasatiko vā jātiyā, so ca kāme
analyzed: vuddhaḥ ce pi brāhmaṇa hoti āsītikaḥ vā nāvutikaḥ vā vassasatikaḥ vā jātiyā saḥ ca kāme
translated: Brahmin, if an elder enjoys sensual pleasures,

original: paribhuñjati kāmamajjhāvasati kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhati kāmavitakkehi khajjati kāmapariyesanāya ussuko.
analyzed: paribhuñjati kāmam ajjhāvasati kāma pariḷāhena pariḍayhati kāma vitakkehi khajjati kāma pariyesanāya ussukaḥ
translated: is intent on sensual pleasures, is inflamed by sensual pleasures, is consumed by sensual pleasures, is overwhelmed by sensual pleasures, is on the track of sensual pleasures,

original: Atha kho so bālo na therotveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati.
analyzed: atha khalu saḥ bālaḥ na saṅkhyam gacchati
translated: But he is not considered a senior elder.

original: Daharo cepi, brāhmaṇa, hoti yuvā susukāḷakeso bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā.
analyzed: daharaḥ cepi brāhmaṇa hoti yuvā susu kāḷa kesaḥ bhadrena yobbanena samannāgato paṭhamena vayasā
translated: Brahmin, if a young man is young, youthful, with black hair, endowed with a good complexion, in the first stage of life,

original: So ca na kāme paribhuñjati na kāmamajjhāvasati, na kāmapariḷāhena pariḍayhati, na kāmavitakkehi khajjati, na kāmapariyesanāya ussuko.
analyzed: saḥ ca na kāme paribhuñjati na kāmam ajjhāvasati na kāma pariḷāhena pariḍayhati na kāma vitakkehi khajjati na kāma pariyesanāya ussukaḥ
translated: and he does not enjoy sensual pleasures, does not delight in sensual pleasures, does not burn with fever for sensual pleasures, is not consumed by craving for sensual pleasures, and is not intent on seeking sensual pleasures,

original: Atha kho so paṇḍito therotveva saṅkhyaṁ gacchatī”ti.
analyzed: atha kho saḥ paṇḍitaḥ theraḥ tvā iva saṅkhyam gacchati iti
translated: then he is considered a senior elder.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, kandarāyano brāhmaṇo uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā daharānaṁ sataṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde sirasā vandati:
analyzed: evam vutte kandarāyanaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā daharānam satam bhikkhūnam pāde sirasā vandati
translated: When this was said, the brahmin Kandarāyana rose from his seat, and after arranging his upper robe on one shoulder, he paid homage to the young bhikkhus, raising his joined palms in reverential salutation:

analyzed: vuddhāḥ bhavantaḥ vuddha bhūmiyam ṭhitā
translated: “Venerable sirs, you are seniors, you are established in seniority.

analyzed: daharā maya dahara bhūmi iyam ṭhitā ati
translated: We are juniors, we are established in juniority.”

original: “Abhikkantaṁ, bho kaccāna …pe… upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ kaccāno dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: abhikkanta bho kaccāna pe upāsakam mam bhavam kaccānaḥ dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: “Excellent, Master Kaccana! … From today let Master Kaccana remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge for life.”

original: “Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye corā balavanto honti, rājāno tasmiṁ samaye dubbalā honti.
analyzed: yasmi bhikkhave samaye corāḥ balavantaḥ honti rājānaḥ tasmiṃ samaye dubbalāḥ honti
translated: “Monks, when thieves are strong and kings are weak,

original: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye rañño na phāsu hoti atiyātuṁ vā niyyātuṁ vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātuṁ.
analyzed: tasmi bhikkhave samaye raññaḥ na phāsu hoti atiyātum vā niyyātum vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātu
translated: then it is not easy for the king to go out or to return or to look around the country.

original: Brāhmaṇagahapatikānampi tasmiṁ samaye na phāsu hoti atiyātuṁ vā niyyātuṁ vā bāhirāni vā kammantāni paṭivekkhituṁ.
analyzed: brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam pi tasmin samaye na phāsu hoti atiyātum vā niyyātum vā bāhirāni vā kammantāni paṭivekkhitu
translated: And it is not easy for the brahmins and householders to go out or to return or to look after their own affairs.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṁ samaye pāpabhikkhū balavanto honti, pesalā bhikkhū tasmiṁ samaye dubbalā honti.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave yasmin samaye pāpa bhikkhū balavantaḥ honti pesalāḥ bhikkhū tasmin samaye dubbalāḥ honti
translated: So too, when bad monks are strong and good monks are weak,

original: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye pesalā bhikkhū tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtāva saṅghamajjhe saṅkasāyanti paccantime vā janapade acchanti.
analyzed: tasmi bhikkhave samaye pesalāḥ bhikkhū tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtāḥ ava saṅgha majjhe saṅkasāyanti paccantime vā janapade acchanti
translated: then the good monks, keeping silent, sit in the midst of the Sangha, shrinking away from their company.

original: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanāhitāya bahujanāsukhāya, bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: tat idam bhikkhave hoti bahu jana ahitāya bahu jana asukhāya bahunaḥ janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussāna
translated: And this is harmful and detrimental to many people, to the detriment of gods and humans.

original: Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye rājāno balavanto honti, corā tasmiṁ samaye dubbalā honti.
analyzed: yasmi bhikkhave samaye rājānaḥ balavantaḥ honti corā tasmiṃ samaye dubbalāḥ honti
translated: When kings are powerful, thieves are weak.

original: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye rañño phāsu hoti atiyātuṁ vā niyyātuṁ vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātuṁ.
analyzed: tasmi bhikkhave samaye rañño phāsu hoti atiyātum vā niyyātum vā paccantime vā janapade anusaññātu
translated: Then the king can travel around and visit the countryside with ease.

original: Brāhmaṇagahapatikānampi tasmiṁ samaye phāsu hoti atiyātuṁ vā niyyātuṁ vā bāhirāni vā kammantāni paṭivekkhituṁ.
analyzed: brāhmaṇa gahapatikānam pi tasmin samaye phāsu hoti atiyātum vā niyyātum vā bāhirāni vā kammantāni paṭivekkhitu
translated: Brahmins and householders can travel around and visit the countryside with ease.

original: Evamevaṁ kho, bhikkhave, yasmiṁ samaye pesalā bhikkhū balavanto honti, pāpabhikkhū tasmiṁ samaye dubbalā honti.
analyzed: evam evam kho bhikkhave yasmin samaye pesalāḥ bhikkhū balavantaḥ honti pāpa bhikkhū tasmin samaye dubbalāḥ honti
translated: In the same way, when good monks are powerful, bad monks are weak.

original: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, samaye pāpabhikkhū tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtāva saṅghamajjhe saṅkasāyanti, yena vā pana tena pakkamanti.
analyzed: tasmi bhikkhave samaye pāpa bhikkhū tuṇhībhūtā tuṇhībhūtā ava saṅgha majjhe saṅkasāyanti yena vā pana tena pakkamanti
translated: Then the bad monks sit quietly in the midst of the Sangha, shrinking away, or they leave.

original: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, hoti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: tat idam bhikkhave hoti bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti
translated: This is for the benefit and happiness of many people, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.”

original: “Dvinnāhaṁ, bhikkhave, micchāpaṭipattiṁ na vaṇṇemi, gihissa vā pabbajitassa vā.
analyzed: bhikkhave micchā paṭipattim na vaṇṇemi gihissa vā pabbajitassa vā
translated: “I don’t praise the wrong practice of either a householder or one gone forth.

original: Gihī vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā micchāpaṭipanno micchāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu na ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalaṁ.
analyzed: gihī vā bhikkhave pabbajitaḥ vā micchā paṭipannaḥ micchā paṭipatta adhikaraṇa hetu na ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusala
translated: Whether a householder or one gone forth, one of wrong practice, because of wrong practice, is not fulfilling the true Dhamma.

original: Dvinnāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sammāpaṭipattiṁ vaṇṇemi, gihissa vā pabbajitassa vā.
analyzed: bhikkhave sammā paṭipattim vaṇṇemi gihissa vā pabbajitassa vā
translated: I praise the right practice of either a householder or one gone forth.

original: Gihī vā, bhikkhave, pabbajito vā sammāpaṭipanno sammāpaṭipattādhikaraṇahetu ārādhako hoti ñāyaṁ dhammaṁ kusalan”ti.
analyzed: gihī vā bhikkhave pabbajitaḥ vā sammāpaṭipannaḥ sammāpaṭipatta adhikaraṇa hetu ārādhakaḥ hoti ñāyam dhammam kusalanti
translated: Whether a householder or one gone forth, one of right practice, because of right practice, is fulfilling the true Dhamma.”

original: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū duggahitehi suttantehi byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañca🔽dhammañca paṭibāhanti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanāhitāya paṭipannā bahujanāsukhāya,
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū duggahitehi suttantehi byañjana patirūpakehi attham ca  dhammañca paṭibāhanti te bhikkhave bhikkhū bahu jana ahitāya paṭipannāḥ bahu jana asukhāya
translated: “Monks, those monks who, with poorly grasped discourses, with a semblance of discourses, deny the meaning and the Teaching

original: bahuno janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: bahunaḥ janassa anatthāya ahitāya dukkhāya deva manussāna
translated: are practicing for the harm of many people, for the unhappiness of many people, for the ruin, harm, and suffering of many people, of devas and human beings.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apuññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ antaradhāpenti.
analyzed: bahum ca te bhikkhave bhikkhū apuññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ antaradhāpenti
translated: They make much demerit and they cause the true Teaching to disappear quickly.

original: Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi byañjanappatirūpakehi atthañca dhammañca🔽anulomenti te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bahujanahitāya paṭipannā bahujanasukhāya, bahuno
analyzed: ye te bhikkhave bhikkhū suggahitehi suttantehi byañjana patirūpakehi atthañca dhammañca  anulomenti te bhikkhave bhikkhū bahu jana hitāya paṭipannāḥ bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ
translated: “Those who explain the Teaching and the meaning in accordance with the discourses that are well given and that are similar to the discourses

analyzed: janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: are acting for the welfare of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the good, welfare, and happiness of many people, including gods and humans.

original: Bahuñca te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū puññaṁ pasavanti, te cimaṁ saddhammaṁ ṭhapentī”ti.
analyzed: bahuñca te bhikkhave bhikkhū puññam pasavanti te ca imam saddhammaṃ ṭhapenti iti
translated: They make much merit and they cause the true Teaching to remain for a long time.”

analyzed: samacitta vaggo catutthaḥ  aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The fourth sub-chapter on the mind is finished.🔽The Collection of Long Sayings

analyzed: parisavagga
translated: . The Chapter on the Assembly

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “There are these two assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What are the two?

original: Uttānā ca parisā gambhīrā ca parisā.
analyzed: uttānā ca parisā gambhīrā ca parisā
translated: The shallow assembly and the deep assembly.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave uttānā parisā
translated: What is the shallow assembly?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū uddhatā honti unnaḷā capalā mukharā vikiṇṇavācā muṭṭhassatī asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhantacittā pākatindriyā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū uddhatāḥ honti unnaḷā capalāḥ mukharāḥ vikiṇṇa vācā muṭṭha ssatī asampajānā asamāhitā vibbhanta cittā pāka tindriyā
translated: There may be a gathering where the monks are restless, puffed up, vain, talkative, rambling in their talk, heedless, not knowing the time, not understanding time as it comes, not respectful, not reverential, not rising up from their seats to greet others, not placing their robes over one shoulder, not practicing as they should.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave uttānā parisā
translated: This is called a shallow gathering.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave gambhīrā parisā
translated: And what is a deep gathering?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū anuddhatā honti anunnaḷā acapalā amukharā avikiṇṇavācā upaṭṭhitassatī sampajānā samāhitā ekaggacittā saṁvutindriyā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū anuddhatāḥ honti an unnaḷāḥ a capalāḥ a mukharāḥ a vikiṇṇa vācāḥ upaṭṭhita ssatī sampajānā samāhitā ekagga cittā savuti indriyā
translated: There may be a gathering where the monks are not restless, not puffed up, not vain, not talkative, not rambling in their talk, heedful, knowing the time, understanding time as it comes, respectful, reverential, rising up from their seats to greet others, placing their robes over one shoulder, practicing as they should.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave gambhīrā parisā
translated: This is called a deep gathering.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of gatherings.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ gambhīrā parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam gambhīrā parisā ati
translated: The better of the two is the deep gathering.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Monks, there are these two kinds of gatherings.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

original: Vaggā ca parisā samaggā ca parisā.
analyzed: vaggā ca parisā samaggā ca parisā
translated: A divided gathering and an united gathering.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave vaggā parisā
translated: What is a divided gathering?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū bhaṇḍana jātā kalaha jātā vivāda āpannāḥ aññam aññam mukha sattīhi vitudantāḥ viharanti
translated: It’s when the monks in a gathering are disputing, quarreling, and fighting, wounding each other with weapons of the mouth, such as: ‘Worthy Sir, you don’t understand this Teaching and Training. I understand this Teaching and Training. What, you understand this Teaching and Training? You’re practicing wrong. I’m practicing right. I won’t get up for you. You should get up for me.’

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave vaggā parisā
translated: This is called a divided gathering.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave samaggā parisā
translated: And what is a united gathering?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā khīrodakībhūtā aññamaññaṁ piyacakkhūhi sampassantā viharanti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū samaggā sammodamānā a vivadamānā khīrodakībhūtāḥ aññam aññam piya cakkhūhi sampassantā viharanti
translated: It’s when the monks in a gathering are unified, harmonious, and meld together like milk and water, regarding each other with eyes of affection.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave samaggā parisā
translated: This is called a united gathering.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of gatherings.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ samaggā parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam samaggā parisā ati
translated: The better of the two is the united gathering.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Monks, there are these two kinds of gatherings.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What are the two?

original: Anaggavatī ca parisā aggavatī ca parisā.
analyzed: anaggavatī ca parisā aggavatī ca parisā
translated: A gathering that is not supreme and a gathering that is supreme.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave anaggavatī parisā
translated: And what is a gathering that is not supreme?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ therā bhikkhū bāhulikā honti sāthalikā, okkamane
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam therāḥ bhikkhū bāhulikāḥ honti sāthalikāḥ okkamane
translated: It’s when the senior monks in a gathering are luxurious and lax, leaders in backsliding, discarding the duty of solitude;

original: pubbaṅgamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṁ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa
analyzed: pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhitta dhurā na vīriyam ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā an adhigatassa
translated: They are not leaders in seclusion, nor do they encourage others to be leaders in seclusion. They do not exert themselves in being heedful, nor do they encourage others to be heedful.

analyzed: adhigamāya a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: They do not arouse energy for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the as-yet-unachieved, for the realization of the as-yet-unrealized.

analyzed: tesam pacchimā janatā diṭṭha anugatim āpajjati
translated: The later generations follow their example.

original: Sāpi hoti bāhulikā sāthalikā, okkamane pubbaṅgamā, paviveke nikkhittadhurā, na vīriyaṁ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
analyzed: sā api hoti bāhulikā sāthalikā okkamane pubbaṅgamā paviveke nikkhitta dhurā na vīriyam ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: They, too, are luxurious and lax, leaders in backsliding, discarding the duty of solitude; they do not exert themselves in being heedful, nor do they encourage others to be heedful.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave anaggavatī parisā
translated: This is called a low assembly.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave aggavatī parisā
translated: “And what is a high assembly?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ therā bhikkhū na bāhulikā honti na sāthalikā, okkamane🔽nikkhittadhurā, paviveke pubbaṅgamā, vīriyaṁ ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam therāḥ bhikkhū na bāhulikāḥ honti na sāthalikāḥ okkamane  nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamāḥ vīriyam ārabhanti appattassa pattiyā an adhigatassa
translated: There is the case where the elder monks in a certain community are not luxurious or lax, not heedless or careless, not prone to idleness, not leaders in backsliding.🔽They exert themselves in being heedful, and they encourage others to be heedful.

analyzed: adhigamāya a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: They arouse energy for the attainment of the as-yet-unattained, for the achievement of the as-yet-unachieved, for the realization of the as-yet-unrealized.

analyzed: tesam pacchimā janatā diṭṭha anugatim āpajjati
translated: The later generations follow their example.

original: Sāpi hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā, okkamane nikkhittadhurā, paviveke pubbaṅgamā, vīriyaṁ ārabhati appattassa pattiyā anadhigatassa adhigamāya asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.
analyzed: sā api hoti na bāhulikā na sāthalikā okkamane nikkhitta dhurā paviveke pubbaṅgamā vīriyam ārabhati appattassa pattiyā an adhigatassa adhigamāya a sacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya
translated: And she is not luxurious or lax, but energetic and resolute in renunciation.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave aggavatī parisā
translated: This is called the foremost assembly.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two assemblies.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ aggavatī parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam aggavatī parisā ati
translated: The foremost of these two assemblies is the foremost assembly.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Monks, there are these two assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What are the two?

original: Anariyā ca parisā ariyā ca parisā.
analyzed: anariyā ca parisā ariyā ca parisā
translated: The ignoble assembly and the noble assembly.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave anariyā parisā
translated: What is the ignoble assembly?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānanti,🔽‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ nappajānanti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: idha bhikkhave parisāyam bhikkhū idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam na ppajānanti  ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam na ppajānanti ayam dukkha nirodho ti yathābhūta
translated: It is the assembly in which the monks do not understand as it really is:🔽‘This is suffering,’🔽‘This is the origin of suffering,’🔽‘This is the cessation of suffering,’

analyzed: na ppajānanti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam na ppajānanti
translated: ‘This is the way leading to the cessation of suffering.’

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave anariyā parisā
translated: This is called an ignoble assembly.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave ariyā parisā
translated: “And what is an noble assembly?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū ‘idaṁ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānanti,🔽‘ayaṁ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṁ pajānanti, ‘ayaṁ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṁ
analyzed: idha bhikkhave parisāyam bhikkhū idam dukkhan ti yathābhūtam pajānanti  ayam dukkha samudayaḥ iti yathābhūtam pajānanti ayam dukkha nirodho iti yathābhūta
translated: It’s when the monks in a given community understand as it really is: ‘This is suffering.’🔽They understand as it really is: ‘This is the origination of suffering.’ They understand as it really is: ‘This is the cessation of suffering.’ They understand as it really is:

analyzed: pajānanti ayam dukkha nirodha gāminī paṭipadā ati yathābhūtam pajānanti
translated: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave ariyā parisā
translated: This is called an noble assembly.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of assemblies.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ ariyā parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam ariyā parisā ati
translated: The better of the two is the noble assembly.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Monks, there are these two assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

analyzed: parisākasaṭaḥ ca parisāmaṇḍaḥ ca
translated: The assembly of the vulgar and the assembly of the noble ones.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave parisākasaṭaḥ
translated: “And what is the assembly of the vulgar?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū chandāgatiṁ gacchanti, dosāgatiṁ gacchanti, mohāgatiṁ gacchanti, bhayāgatiṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū chanda āgatim gacchanti dosa āgatim gacchanti moha āgatim gacchanti bhaya āgatim gacchanti
translated: It’s when the monks in a given community go by favoritism, go by aversion, go by delusion, go by fear.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave parisākasaṭaḥ
translated: This is called a council of the bad.

analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave parisāmaṇḍaḥ
translated: “And what is a council of the good?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū na chandāgatiṁ gacchanti, na dosāgatiṁ gacchanti, na mohāgatiṁ gacchanti, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū na chanda āgatim gacchanti na dosa āgatim gacchanti na moha āgatim gacchanti na bhaya āgatim gacchanti
translated: It’s when a Saṅgha of monks doesn’t side with favoritism, aversion, delusion, or fear.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave parisāmaṇḍaḥ
translated: This is called a council of the good.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two councils.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ parisāmaṇḍo”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam parisāmaṇḍaḥ ti
translated: The better of the two is the council of the good.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Monks, there are these two councils.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

original: Okkācitavinītā parisā nopaṭipucchāvinītā, paṭipucchāvinītā parisā nookkācitavinītā.
analyzed: okka ācita vinītā parisā no upaṭipucchā vinītā paṭipucchā vinītā parisā no ukka ācita vinītā
translated: A council that is trained in mere recitation, not in questioning; and a council that is trained in questioning, not in mere recitation.

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, okkācitavinītā parisā nopaṭipucchāvinītā?
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave okkā ācita vinītā parisā na upaṭipucchā vinītā
translated: “And what is a council that is trained in mere recitation, not in questioning?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū ye te suttantā tathāgata bhāsitā gambhīrā
translated: It’s when a Saṅgha of monks recites the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the outlines, but doesn’t question and analyze the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the outlines.

original: gambhīratthā lokuttarā suññatāpaṭisaṁyuttā tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsanti na sotaṁ
analyzed: gambhīra atthā lokuttarā suñña tā paṭisayuttā tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsanti na
translated: When the deep, deep suttas of the Dhamma,🔽which are concerned with emptiness, are being recited, they do not want to listen.

original: odahanti na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṁ pariyāpuṇitabbaṁ maññanti.
analyzed: odahanti na aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbam pariyāpuṇitabbam maññanti
translated: They do not lend an ear or apply their minds to understand them, and they think that those teachings are not worth grasping or remembering.

original: Ye pana te suttantā kavitā kāveyyā cittakkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā🔽tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsanti sotaṁ odahanti aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, te dhamme uggahetabbaṁ
analyzed: ye pana te suttantā kavi tā kāveyyā citta kkharā citta byañjanā bāhirakā sāvaka bhāsi tā  tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsanti sotam odahanti aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti te dhamme uggahetabba
translated: But when the suttas are being recited that are poetry composed by poets—beautiful in words and phrases, created by outsiders,🔽spoken by disciples,🔽they want to listen. They lend an ear and apply their minds to understand them, and they think that those teachings are worth grasping and remembering.

original: pariyāpuṇitabbaṁ maññanti, te ca taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇitvā na ceva aññamaññaṁ paṭipucchanti
analyzed: pariyāpuṇitabbam maññanti te ca tam dhammam pariyāpuṇitvā na ca iva aññam aññam paṭipucchanti
translated: But having grasped and remembered those teachings, they do not discuss them with one another,

analyzed: na ca paṭivicaranti
translated: saying:

analyzed: idam kathā imassa kaḥ attho ti
translated: ‘This is how this teaching should be interpreted, this is what it means.’

original: Te avivaṭañceva na vivaranti, anuttānīkatañca na uttānīkaronti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṁ na paṭivinodenti.
analyzed: te a vivaṭam ca iva na vivaranti an uttānīkatam ca na uttānīkaronti aneka vihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkham na paṭivinodenti
translated: They do not clarify what is unclear, do not remove doubts about what is puzzling, and do not give reasons for what is obscure.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, okkācitavinītā parisā no paṭipucchāvinītā.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave okkā ācita vinītā parisā no paṭipucchā vinītā
translated: This is called a discussion that is cultivated by those who are self-confident, not by those who ask questions.

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, paṭipucchāvinītā parisā nookkācitavinītā?
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave paṭipucchā vinītā parisā no ukka ācita vinītā
translated: “And what is a discussion that is cultivated by those who ask questions, not by those who are self-confident?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū ye te suttantā kavitā kāveyyā cittakkharā
analyzed: idha bhikkhave parisāyam bhikkhū ye te suttantā kavi tā kāveyyā citta kkharā
translated: It may be that in a certain discussion, monks are reciting discourses that are poetry, chants, exclamations,🔽stanzas, those of the first utterance, those in sequence, stories, birth stories, marvels,

original: cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsanti na sotaṁ odahanti
analyzed: citta byañjanā bāhirakā sāvaka bhāsitā tesu bhaññamānesu na sussūsanti na sotam odahanti
translated: and transmissions—and they are not eager to listen, do not lend an ear,

original: na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, na ca te dhamme uggahetabbaṁ pariyāpuṇitabbaṁ maññanti.
analyzed: na aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti na ca te dhamme uggahetabbam pariyāpuṇitabbam maññanti
translated: do not apply their minds to understand, and do not consider those teachings to be worth grasping or mastering.

original: Ye pana te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīratthā lokuttarā suññatāpaṭisaṁyuttā
analyzed: ye pana te suttantā tathāgata bhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīra atthā lokuttarā suñña tā paṭisayuttā
translated: But when discourses spoken by the Tathāgata are being recited—deep, deep in meaning, transcendent, connected with emptiness—🔽they are eager to listen, lend an ear,

original: tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsanti sotaṁ odahanti aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, te ca dhamme🔽uggahetabbaṁ pariyāpuṇitabbaṁ maññanti.
analyzed: tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsanti sotam odahanti aññā cittam upaṭṭhapenti te ca dhamme  uggahetabbam pariyāpuṇitabbam maññanti
translated: apply their minds to understand, and consider those teachings to be worth grasping and mastering.

original: Te taṁ dhammaṁ pariyāpuṇitvā aññamaññaṁ paṭipucchanti paṭivicaranti:
analyzed: te tam dhammam pariyāpuṇitvā aññam aññam paṭipucchanti paṭivicaranti
translated: Having mastered those teachings, they question and examine each other:

analyzed: idam kathā imassa kaḥ attho ti
translated: ‘What’s this? What does this mean?’

original: Te avivaṭañceva vivaranti, anuttānīkatañca uttānīkaronti, anekavihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinodenti.
analyzed: te a vivaṭam ca iva vivaranti an uttānīkatam ca uttānīkaronti aneka vihitesu ca kaṅkhāṭhāniyesu dhammesu kaṅkham paṭivinodenti
translated: They explain what’s obscure, make the meaning clear, and dispel doubt regarding many kinds of questions.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, paṭipucchāvinītā parisā nookkācitavinītā.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave paṭipucchā vinītā parisā no ukkā ācita vinītā
translated: This is called a well-instructed assembly, not a poorly-instructed one.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of assemblies.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ paṭipucchāvinītā parisā nookkācitavinītā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam paṭipucchā vinītā parisā na uokkā ācita vinītā ati
translated: The better of the two is the well-instructed assembly, not the poorly-instructed one.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “There are these two assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

original: Āmisagaru parisā no saddhammagaru, saddhammagaru parisā no āmisagaru.
analyzed: āmisa garu parisā no saddhamma garu saddhamma garu parisā no āmisa garu
translated: An assembly that respects material things, not the Teaching; and an assembly that respects the Teaching, not material things.

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, āmisagaru parisā no saddhammagaru?
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave āmisa garu parisā no saddhamma garu
translated: What is an assembly that respects material things, not the Teaching?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ sammukhā aññamaññassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū gihīnam odāta vasanānam sammukhāḥ aññamaññassa vaṇṇam bhāsanti
translated: It’s an assembly of monks who praise each other in the presence of lay people who wear white:

original: ‘asuko bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto, asuko paññāvimutto, asuko kāyasakkhī, asuko diṭṭhippatto,
analyzed: asukaḥ bhikkhu ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ asukaḥ paññā vimuttaḥ asukaḥ kāya sakkhī asukaḥ diṭṭhi ppatto
translated: ‘This monk is liberated in both ways, this monk is liberated by wisdom, this monk is a body witness, this monk is attained to view,

original: asuko saddhāvimutto, asuko dhammānusārī, asuko saddhānusārī, asuko sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo,
analyzed: asukaḥ saddhā vimuttaḥ asukaḥ dhamma anusārī asukaḥ saddhā anusārī asukaḥ sīlavā kalyāṇa dhammo
translated: this monk is liberated by faith, this monk is a Dhamma follower, this monk is a faith follower, this monk is virtuous and of good character,

analyzed: asukaḥ dussīlaḥ pāpa dhammaḥ ti
translated: this monk is immoral and of bad character.’

analyzed: te tena lābham labhanti
translated: They get gains because of that.

original: Te taṁ lābhaṁ labhitvā gathitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: te tam lābham labhitvā gathitāḥ mucchitāḥ ajjhopannāḥ anādīnava dassāvinaḥ a nissaraṇa paññā paribhuñjanti
translated: They use those gains while tied to them, infatuated with them, not seeing the danger in them, not understanding the escape.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, āmisagaru parisā no saddhammagaru.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave āmisa garu parisā no saddhamma garu
translated: This is called a gathering that respects material things, not the true Dhamma.

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, saddhammagaru parisā noāmisagaru?
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave saddhamma garu parisā no āmisa garu
translated: And what is a gathering that respects the true Dhamma, not material things?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ sammukhā aññamaññassa vaṇṇaṁ na bhāsanti:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū gihīnam odāta vasanānam sammukhāḥ aññamaññassa vaṇṇam na bhāsanti
translated: It’s a gathering in which the monks don’t praise each other in the presence of the lay people:

original: ‘asuko bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto, asuko paññāvimutto, asuko kāyasakkhī, asuko diṭṭhippatto,
analyzed: asukaḥ bhikkhu ubhatobhāga vimuttaḥ asukaḥ paññā vimuttaḥ asukaḥ kāya sakkhī asukaḥ diṭṭhi ppatto
translated: ‘This monk is liberated in both ways, this monk is liberated by wisdom, this monk is a body witness, this monk is attained to view,

original: asuko saddhāvimutto, asuko dhammānusārī, asuko saddhānusārī, asuko sīlavā kalyāṇadhammo,
analyzed: asukaḥ saddhā vimuttaḥ asukaḥ dhamma anusārī asukaḥ saddhā anusārī asukaḥ sīlavā kalyāṇa dhammo
translated: ‘So-and-so is liberated by faith, so-and-so by seeing; so-and-so is a faith-follower, so-and-so a Dhamma-follower; so-and-so is virtuous, of good character,

analyzed: asukaḥ dussīlaḥ pāpa dhammaḥ ti
translated: so-and-so is immoral, of evil character.’

analyzed: te tena lābham labhanti
translated: They get gains because of that.

original: Te taṁ lābhaṁ labhitvā agathitā amucchitā anajjhosannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.
analyzed: te tam lābham labhitvā a gathitāḥ a mucchitāḥ an ajjhosannāḥ ādīnava dassāvinaḥ nissaraṇa paññā paribhuñjanti
translated: But they use those gains without being tied to them, infatuated with them, and blindly absorbed in them; they use them wisely, seeing the danger in them and understanding the escape from them.

original: Ayaṁ vuccati, bhikkhave, saddhammagaru parisā noāmisagaru.
analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave saddhamma garu parisā no āmisa garu
translated: This is called a gathering that respects the true Dhamma, not material things.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of gatherings.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ saddhammagaru parisā noāmisagarū”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam saddhamma garu parisā noāmisa garu ti
translated: The better of the two is the gathering that respects the true Dhamma, not material things.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “There are these two kinds of gatherings.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

original: Visamā ca parisā samā ca parisā.
analyzed: visamā ca parisā samā ca parisā
translated: An uneven gathering and an even gathering.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave visamā parisā
translated: What is an uneven gathering?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ adhammakammāni pavattanti dhammakammāni nappavattanti,
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam adhamma kammāni pavattanti dhamma kammāni na ppavattanti
translated: It’s a gathering in which unrighteous deeds are done and righteous deeds are not done,

original: avinayakammāni pavattanti vinayakammāni nappavattanti, adhammakammāni dippanti dhammakammāni
analyzed: a vinaya kammāni pavattanti vinaya kammāni na pavattanti adhamma kammāni dippanti dhamma kammāni
translated: legal procedures done in the wrong way are done, while legal procedures done in the proper way are not done;🔽illegal procedures are done, while legal procedures are not done;🔽legal procedures done in the wrong way are done, while legal procedures done in the proper way are not done;

original: na dippanti, avinayakammāni dippanti vinayakammāni na dippanti.
analyzed: na dippanti avinaya kammāni dippanti vinaya kammāni na dippanti
translated: illegal procedures are done, while legal procedures are not done.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave visamā parisā
translated: This is called an unbalanced assembly. …

original: Katamā ca, bhikkhave, samā parisā?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ dhammakammāni pavattanti adhammakammāni nappavattanti,
analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave samā parisā  idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam dhamma kammāni pavattanti adhamma kammāni na pavattanti
translated: And what is a balanced assembly?🔽It’s an assembly in which legal procedures done in the wrong way are not done, while legal procedures done in the proper way are done;

original: vinayakammāni pavattanti avinayakammāni nappavattanti, dhammakammāni dippanti adhammakammāni
analyzed: vinaya kammāni pavattanti avinaya kammāni na pavattanti dhamma kammāni dippanti adhamma kammāni
translated: legal procedures done in the wrong way are not done, while legal procedures done in the proper way are done;🔽illegal procedures are not done, while legal procedures are done;

original: na dippanti, vinayakammāni dippanti avinayakammāni na dippanti.
analyzed: na dippanti vinaya kammāni dippanti avinaya kammāni na dippanti
translated: illegal procedures are not done, while legal procedures are done.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave samā parisā
translated: This is called a balanced assembly. …

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of assemblies.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ samā parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam samā parisā ati
translated: The better of the two is the balanced assembly.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “There are these two assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What are the two?

original: Adhammikā ca parisā dhammikā ca parisā …pe… imā kho, bhikkhave, dve parisā.
analyzed: adhammikā ca parisā dhammikā ca parisā pe imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: There are these two kinds of assemblies.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammikā parisā”ti.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam dhammikā parisā ati
translated: The superior one of these two is the righteous assembly.”

analyzed: dve imā bhikkhave parisā
translated: “Bhikkhus, there are these two kinds of assemblies.

analyzed: katamā dve
translated: What two?

original: Adhammavādinī ca parisā dhammavādinī ca parisā.
analyzed: adhamma vādinī ca parisā dhamma vādinī ca parisā
translated: An assembly that speaks contrary to the Dhamma and an assembly that speaks in accordance with the Dhamma.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave adhamma vādinī parisā
translated: “What, bhikkhus, is an assembly that speaks contrary to the Dhamma?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū adhikaraṇaṁ ādiyanti dhammikaṁ vā adhammikaṁ vā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū adhikaraṇam ādiyanti dhammikam vā adhammikam vā
translated: It is an assembly of bhikkhus in which the bhikkhus take up a legal issue whether legally valid or legally invalid.🔽Having taken it up, they do not resolve it either by face-to-face settlement or by majority decision.

original: Te taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ ādiyitvā na ceva aññamaññaṁ saññāpenti na ca saññattiṁ upagacchanti, na ca nijjhāpenti na ca nijjhattiṁ upagacchanti.🔽Te asaññattibalā anijjhattibalā appaṭinissaggamantino tameva adhikaraṇaṁ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharanti:
analyzed: te tam adhikaraṇam ādiyitvā na ca iva aññam aññam saññāpenti na ca saññattim upagacchanti na ca nijjhāpenti na ca nijjhattim upagacchanti  te a saññatti balāḥ an ijjhatti balāḥ a paṭinissagga mantinaḥ tam eva adhikaraṇam thāmasāḥ parāmāsāḥ abhinivissa voharanti
translated: They do not resolve it either by means of a committee or by means of further-punishment.

analyzed: idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: They do not resolve it by means of covering over as if with grass.🔽They insist on their own views, hold on to them tenaciously, and relinquish them with difficulty.

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave adhamma vādinī parisā
translated: This is called a gathering that speaks contrary to the Teaching.

analyzed: katamā ca bhikkhave dhamma vādinī parisā
translated: And what is a gathering that speaks in accordance with the Teaching?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, yassaṁ parisāyaṁ bhikkhū adhikaraṇaṁ ādiyanti dhammikaṁ vā adhammikaṁ vā.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave yassam parisāyam bhikkhū adhikaraṇam ādiyanti dhammikam vā adhammikam vā
translated: It’s when the monks in a gathering take up a legal issue, whether legitimate or not.

original: Te taṁ adhikaraṇaṁ ādiyitvā aññamaññaṁ saññāpenti ceva saññattiñca upagacchanti, nijjhāpenti ceva nijjhattiñca upagacchanti.🔽Te saññattibalā nijjhattibalā paṭinissaggamantino, na tameva adhikaraṇaṁ thāmasā parāmāsā abhinivissa voharanti:
analyzed: te tam adhikaraṇam ādiyitvā aññam aññam saññāpenti ca iva saññattim ca upagacchanti nijjhāpenti ca iva nijjhattim ca upagacchanti  te saññatti balāḥ nijjhatti balāḥ paṭinissagga mantinaḥ na tam eva adhikaraṇam thāmasāḥ parāmāsāḥ abhinivissa voharanti
translated: They then persuade each other and agree, and they accuse each other and agree.

analyzed: idam eva saccam mogham aññanti
translated: And they are able to reach a resolution by means of the majority decision. They don’t keep on insisting on their own views, clinging to them and saying, ‘Only this is the truth, anything else is wrong.’

analyzed: ayam vuccati bhikkhave dhamma vādinī parisā
translated: This is called a gathering that speaks in accordance with the Teaching.

analyzed: imāḥ kho bhikkhave dve parisā
translated: These are the two kinds of gatherings.

original: Etadaggaṁ, bhikkhave, imāsaṁ dvinnaṁ parisānaṁ yadidaṁ dhammavādinī parisā”ti.🔽Parisavaggo pañcamo.
analyzed: etat agga bhikkhave imāsam dvinnam parisānam yat idam dhamma vādinī parisā ati  parisavaggaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: The best of these two is the gathering that speaks in accordance with the Teaching.”

analyzed: tassa uddāna  uttānāḥ vaggāḥ aggavatī
translated: The fifth chapter on gatherings is finished.🔽The summary:🔽The chapter on the upright, the foremost,

analyzed: ariyā kasaṭaḥ ca pañcamaḥ
translated: The noble, the rubbish heap, and the fifth,

analyzed: okkā citaḥ āmisañca iva
translated: The food is covered over,

analyzed: visamāḥ adhamma ādhammiyena ca ati
translated: and the unevenness is by way of the True Idea and what is not the True Idea.

analyzed: paṭhamo paṇṇāsakaḥ samatto
translated: The first fifty is finished.

analyzed: aṅguttara nikāya
translated: The Book of the Tens

analyzed: puggala vagga
translated: The Group of People

original: “Dveme, bhikkhave, puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
analyzed: dve me bhikkhave puggalāḥ loke uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Bhikkhus, these two people arise in the world for the benefit of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, for the welfare of devas and humans.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ca araham sammāsambuddhaḥ rājā ca cakkavattī
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and a wheel-turning monarch.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve puggalā loke uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya bahunaḥ janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussānam ti
translated: These are the two people who arise in the world for the benefit of the multitude, for the happiness of the multitude, for the welfare of devas and humans.”

original: “Dveme, bhikkhave, puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti acchariyamanussā.
analyzed: dve me bhikkhave puggalā loke uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti acchariya manussā
translated: “Bhikkhus, these two people arise in the world as marvels.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Tathāgato ca arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ca araham sammāsambuddhaḥ rājā ca cakkavattī
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and a wheel-turning monarch.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti acchariyamanussā”ti.

translated: The Realised One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, and the Independent Sambuddha.

translated: The monk who is free from the pollutants, and the thoroughbred horse.

analyzed: katame dve

analyzed: bhikkhu ca khīṇa asavaḥ assājānīyo ca
translated: A monk whose effluents are ended and a thoroughbred horse.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasanti iti
translated: These are the two people who are not afraid when lightning strikes and thunder roars.”

translated: “There are two people who are not afraid when lightning strikes and thunder roars.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Bhikkhu ca khīṇāsavo, sīho ca migarājā.
analyzed: bhikkhu ca khīṇa āsavaḥ sīhaḥ ca miga rājā
translated: A monk whose effluents are ended and a lion, king of beasts.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasanti iti
translated: These are the two people who are not afraid when lightning strikes and thunder roars.”

original: “Dveme, bhikkhave, atthavase sampassamānā kiṁpurisā mānusiṁ vācaṁ na bhāsanti.
analyzed: dve me bhikkhave attha vase sampassamānā kipurisāḥ mānusim vācam na bhāsanti
translated: “Monks, there are two reasons why the Kinnaras don’t speak the human speech.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What two?

original: Mā ca musā bhaṇimhā, mā ca paraṁ abhūtena abbhācikkhimhāti.
analyzed: mā ca musā bhaṇimhā mā ca param abhūtena abbhācikkhimha ati
translated: So that we won’t lie and so that we won’t falsely accuse others.

original: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve atthavase sampassamānā kiṁpurisā mānusiṁ vācaṁ na bhāsantī”ti.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave dve atthavase sampassamānā kipurisāḥ mānusim vācam na bhāsanti iti
translated: These are the two reasons why the Kinnaras don’t speak the human speech.”

original: “Dvinnaṁ dhammānaṁ, bhikkhave, atitto appaṭivāno mātugāmo kālaṁ karoti.
analyzed: dvinnam bhikkhave a tittaḥ a paṭivānaḥ mātugāmaḥ kālam karoti
translated: “Monks, there are two things that a woman, overcome by passion, will not consider a hardship.

analyzed: katamesam dvinna
translated: What two?

analyzed: methuna samāpattiyāḥ ca vijāyanassa ca
translated: Sexual intercourse and giving birth.

original: Imesaṁ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṁ dhammānaṁ atitto appaṭivāno mātugāmo kālaṁ karotī”ti.
analyzed: imesam kho bhikkhave dvinnam dhammānam a tittaḥ a paṭivānaḥ mātugāmaḥ kālam karoti iti
translated: It’s because of being dissatisfied and not overcoming these two things that a woman dies.”

analyzed: asanta sannivāsam ca vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi santa sannivāsam ca
translated: “Monks, I will teach you about living with the unsalutary and living with the salutary.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay careful attention, I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, lord,” the monks responded.

analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said this:

original: “Kathañca, bhikkhave, asantasannivāso hoti, kathañca asanto sannivasanti?
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave asanta sannivāsaḥ hoti katham ca asantaḥ sannivasanti
translated: “And how does one live with the unsalutary? How do the unsalutary live together?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, therassa bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave therassa bhikkhuno evam hoti
translated: It’s when an elder monk thinks,

original: ‘theropi maṁ na vadeyya, majjhimopi maṁ na vadeyya, navopi maṁ na vadeyya;
analyzed: theraḥ upi mam na vadeyya majjhimaḥ upi mam na vadeyya navaḥ upi mam na vadeyya
translated: ‘No one should correct me: neither an elder, nor a middle-ranking monk, nor a junior monk.

original: therampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ, majjhimampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ, navampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: therampāham na vadeyya majjhimampāham na vadeyya navampāham na vadeyya
translated: I shouldn’t correct anyone: neither an elder, nor a middle-ranking monk, nor a junior monk.

original: Thero cepi maṁ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṁ vadeyyaṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṁ.
analyzed: thero ce api mama vadeyya ahita anukampī mama vadeyya no hita anukampī no ti nam vadeyyam viheṭheyyam passam pissa na paṭikareyya
translated: If an elder corrects me, he should correct me with compassion, not without compassion. But I would say to him, ‘Don’t correct me.’ I would harass him and not make amends, even if I saw the correction as valid.

original: Majjhimo cepi maṁ vadeyya …pe… navo cepi maṁ vadeyya, ahitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṁ vadeyyaṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṁ’.
analyzed: majjhimo ce api mam vadeyya pe navo ce api mam vadeyya ahita anukampī mam vadeyya no hita anukampī no ti nam vadeyyam viheṭheyyam passam pissa na paṭikareyya
translated: ‘If an elder speaks to me, I’ll speak to him like this and I’ll do this and that.’

original: Majjhimassapi bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti …pe… navassapi bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti:🔽‘theropi maṁ na vadeyya, majjhimopi maṁ na vadeyya, navopi maṁ na vadeyya;
analyzed: majjhimassa api bhikkhuno evam hoti pe navassa api bhikkhuno evam hoti  theraḥ upi mam na vadeyya majjhimaḥ upi mam na vadeyya navaḥ upi mam na vadeyya
translated: ‘If a monk of middle standing speaks to me …’🔽‘If a junior monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him like this and I’ll do this and that.’

original: therampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ, majjhimampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ, navampāhaṁ na vadeyyaṁ.🔽Thero cepi maṁ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no hitānukampī noti naṁ vadeyyaṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṁ.
analyzed: therampāham na vadeyya majjhimampāham na vadeyya navampāham na vadeyya  thero ce api mama vadeyya ahita anukampī mama vadeyya no hita anukampī no ti nam vadeyyam viheṭheyyam passam pissa na paṭikareyya
translated: ‘If an elder speaks to me, I’ll speak to him like this and I’ll do this and that.’🔽‘If a monk of middle standing speaks to me …’

original: Majjhimo cepi maṁ vadeyya … navo cepi maṁ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṁ vadeyyaṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṁ’.
analyzed: majjhimo ce api mam vadeyya navaḥ ce api mam vadeyya ahita anukampī mam vadeyya no hita anukampī no ti nam vadeyyam viheṭheyyam passam pissa na paṭikareyya
translated: ‘If a junior monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him like this and I’ll do this and that.’

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, asantasannivāso hoti, evañca asanto sannivasanti.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave asanta sannivāsaḥ hoti evam ca asantaḥ sannivasanti
translated: That’s how there is bad friendship, how people live in bad friendship.

original: Kathañca, bhikkhave, santasannivāso hoti, kathañca santo sannivasanti?🔽Idha, bhikkhave, therassa bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: katham ca bhikkhave santa sannivāsaḥ hoti katham ca santaḥ sannivasanti  idha bhikkhave therassa bhikkhuno evam hoti
translated: “And how is there good friendship, how do people live in good friendship?🔽It’s when an elder monk thinks, ‘May the elder speak to me, may the middle and new monks speak to me.

original: ‘theropi maṁ vadeyya, majjhimopi maṁ vadeyya, navopi maṁ vadeyya;🔽therampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ, majjhimampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ, navampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: theraḥ upi mam vadeyya majjhimaḥ upi mam vadeyya navaḥ upi mam vadeyya  therampāham vadeyya majjhimampāham vadeyya navampāham vadeyya
translated: I will speak to the elder, I will speak to the middle and new monks.🔽If the elder speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.

original: Thero cepi maṁ vadeyya hitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṁ vadeyyaṁ na naṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa paṭikareyyaṁ.
analyzed: thero ce pi mam vadeyya hita anukampī mam vadeyya no ahita anukampī sādhu uti nam vadeyyam na nam viheṭheyyam passam pissa paṭikareyya
translated: If the middle monk speaks to me … If the new monk speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.’🔽It’s when a middle monk thinks, ‘May the elder speak to me, may the middle and new monks speak to me.🔽I will speak to the elder, I will speak to the middle and new monks.🔽If the elder speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.

original: Majjhimo cepi maṁ vadeyya …pe… navo cepi maṁ vadeyya hitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṁ vadeyyaṁ na naṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa paṭikareyyaṁ’.
analyzed: majjhimo ce api mam vadeyya pe navo ce api mam vadeyya hita anukampī mam vadeyya no ahita anukampī sādhu iti nam vadeyyam na nam viheṭheyyam passam pissa paṭikareyya
translated: If the middle monk speaks to me … If the new monk speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.’🔽It’s when a new monk thinks, ‘May the elder speak to me, may the middle and new monks speak to me.

original: Majjhimassapi bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti …pe… navassapi bhikkhuno evaṁ hoti:
analyzed: majjhimassa api bhikkhuno evam hoti pe navassa api bhikkhuno evam hoti
translated: I will speak to the elder, I will speak to the middle and new monks.🔽If the elder speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.🔽If the middle monk speaks to me … If the new monk speaks to me out of compassion, not out of a lack of compassion, I will say, “Good,” and not cross-examine him.’

original: ‘theropi maṁ vadeyya, majjhimopi maṁ vadeyya, navopi maṁ vadeyya;
analyzed: theraḥ upi mam vadeyya majjhimaḥ upi mam vadeyya navaḥ upi mam vadeyya
translated: ‘Whether it’s an elder, a middle-ranking monk, or a junior monk,🔽I’ll speak to them.

original: therampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ, majjhimampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ, navampāhaṁ vadeyyaṁ.
analyzed: therampāham vadeyya majjhimampāham vadeyya navampāham vadeyya
translated: If an elder speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.🔽If a middle-ranking monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.

original: Thero cepi maṁ vadeyya hitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṁ vadeyyaṁ na naṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa paṭikareyyaṁ.
analyzed: thero ce pi mam vadeyya hita anukampī mam vadeyya no ahita anukampī sādhu uti nam vadeyyam na nam viheṭheyyam passam pissa paṭikareyya
translated: If a junior monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.🔽If an elder speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.🔽If a middle-ranking monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.

original: Majjhimo cepi maṁ vadeyya …pe… navo cepi maṁ vadeyya hitānukampī maṁ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṁ vadeyyaṁ na naṁ viheṭheyyaṁ passampissa paṭikareyyaṁ’.
analyzed: majjhimo ce api mam vadeyya pe navo ce api mam vadeyya hita anukampī mam vadeyya no ahita anukampī sādhu iti nam vadeyyam na nam viheṭheyyam passam pissa paṭikareyya
translated: If a junior monk speaks to me, I’ll speak to him in return.’

original: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, santasannivāso hoti, evañca santo sannivasantī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho bhikkhave santa sannivāsaḥ hoti evam ca santaḥ sannivasanti iti
translated: This is how you live together in harmony, and this is how you should live together in harmony.”

original: “Yasmiṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe ubhato vacīsaṁsāro diṭṭhipaḷāso cetaso āghāto appaccayo anabhiraddhi ajjhattaṁ avūpasantaṁ hoti, tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ:
analyzed: yasmi bhikkhave adhikaraṇe ubhatas vacī sasāraḥ diṭṭhi paḷāsaḥ cetasaḥ āghātaḥ appaccayaḥ an abhiraddhi ajjhattam a vūpasantam hoti tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkha
translated: “When there’s a legal issue that involves mutual verbal abuse, accusations, a lot of people saying ‘it’s true’, and a lot of people saying ‘it’s not true’,

original: ‘dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca na phāsuṁ viharissanti’.
analyzed: dīgha ttāya khara ttāya vāḷa ttāya savattissati bhikkhū ca na phāsum viharissanti
translated: ‘It will last a long time and cause great harm and grumbling, and the monks won’t be at ease.’

original: Yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe ubhato vacīsaṁsāro diṭṭhipaḷāso cetaso āghāto appaccayo anabhiraddhi ajjhattaṁ suvūpasantaṁ hoti, tasmetaṁ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṁ:
analyzed: yasmin ca kho bhikkhave adhikaraṇe ubhatas vacī sasāraḥ diṭṭhi paḷāsaḥ cetasaḥ āghātaḥ appaccayaḥ an abhiraddhi ajjhattam su vūpasantam hoti tasmā ita bhikkhave adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkha
translated: But when in a legal issue both sides have verbal spats, are opinionated, hostile, and distrustful, and one side is calm, it can be expected that

original: ‘na dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṁvattissati, bhikkhū ca phāsuṁ viharissantī’”ti.🔽Puggalavaggo paṭhamo.
analyzed: na dīgha ttāya khara ttāya vāḷa ttāya savattissati bhikkhū ca phāsum viharissanti iti  puggala vaggo paṭhamaḥ
translated: ‘it won’t last a long time and cause great harm and grumbling, and the monks will be at ease.’”
